water's edge are filled with mud and silt deposits from the marsh just
upstream.  You can head downstream to the west, or east into the
beginnings of a marsh.

413.short: ...You're on the south bank of a river.
413.long:
Sunlight reflects off of the ripples in the river surface.  The water
is flowing at a good, steady speed, an improvement over the sluggish
current to the west.  The muddy banks provide homes for many crawfish,
and you can sometimes see them dart out of their lairs.  You can follow
the river downstream to the east, or into the beginnings of a marsh to
the west.

414.short: ...You're on the north bank of a river.
414.long:
The ground is hard and almost rocky beneath your feet, and this area
has a number of trees which are growing well in the sturdy foundation.
Between the cool breeze running through this canyon, and the pleasant
shade of these leafy trees, you hesitate to leave this area.  The river
continues down the canyon to the west, and you can also explore farther
upstream.

415.short: ...You're on the south bank of a river.
415.long:
This section of the river is especially scenic.  Tall grass grows all
along the bank of the river, accompanied only by shade trees which grow
lazily over the water.  Several sandy beaches lay about the edge of the
river, from which you can sometimes notice a flash of silver streaking
just under the surface.  East and west take you farther along the
river.

416.short: ...You're on the north bank of a river.
416.long:
The canyon ends abruptly to the east.  The river, not to be denied,
cuts through the rock wall and persists underground into a dark cave.
The water also heads into another, much smaller cave in a north canyon
wall.  The color of the water is a brilliant aquamarine, and apparently
loaded to the brim with fish, if the constant jumps and splashes you
see are any indication.  Unlike the cave to the east, you cannot enter
the small north cave by land, but it looks like the water level is
shallow enough for you to wade inside.

417.short: ...You're on the south bank of a river.
417.long:
Small, round rocks line the shores here.  The water, due to the lack of
mud and sand found upstream, is remarkably clear and boasts a brilliant
hue of aquamarine.  This small canyon ends just to the east, although
the river continues right into the side of the rock wall and further
underground.  You can still follow the river into the large cave to the
east, or head upstream to the west.

418.short: ...You're in a cave, near a river.
418.long:
It is dark here, but the light from the west exit makes it bright
enough to see.  The water carved walls are smooth and damp with
moisture, extending just a few more feet above your head.  The river
continues to flow farther east into the cave, but the footpath along
the side ends at this point and prevents you from proceeding in that
direction.  The only way out of this place is back to the west.

419.long:
This cave is dim, but made light enough to see by the light of the west
exit.  The walkway you are on rises a good two or three feet above the
river's surface, and you surmise that the gap quickly fills up during
heavy rains.  This path continues, along with the river, downstream to
the east, or you can head back through the west opening into the open
air.

420.long:
It is pretty dark at this point in the cave, although you can still see
the light from both the west and east exits.  You are inching along a
very narrow ledge which sets slightly above an underground river.  You
can hear the river babbling and murmuring and making happy river noises
below you, but it is too dark to see the water surface.  Both west and
east directions lead toward ways out of this cave.

421.long:
A loud, muffled roaring emanates from all directions, as the river
disappears completely into a deeper underground passage.  The mists
from this sunken waterfall make the air here extremely humid, and the
cave walls are dripping wet with moisture.  A faint smell of salt and
brine is also present, and looking west, you can see the cave mouth
open up into a beautiful view of the ocean.

422.long:
This place is lit by diffuse light coming from the opening to the
south.  You are standing in a small amount of water near the center of
the cave.  The air is comfortably cool, and slightly more humid than
the outside air.  Rays of light striking the water near the entrance
cast flickering shadows on the cave ceiling, showing it to be smooth
and rounded.  The only way is back out through the south opening.
422.item: a few inches below the water.

423.short: ...You're on the north end of a rocky beach.
423.long:
Tall cliff walls rise up to the north and west, partial protectors of
this ocean bay.  Out to the east, beyond crashing waves, you can see
the narrow channel which leads to the ocean.  The air is humid and full
of the smells of salt and brine.  Strewn over the rocks and all about
the beach lie the pale green remains seaweed and kelp, torn from the
ocean floor by the powerful waves.  The beach continues for a long
distance to the south.

424.long:
Giant, blue waves rhythmically assault the rocks and send fluid sheets
of foamy water sliding almost to your feet.  This beach overlooks a
beautiful ocean bay.  High bluffs protect the fjord on all sides, but
far to the east the water eventually opens up into the open sea.  A
dark cave proceeds into the side of the cliff, here, and you can pass
through the opening to the west.   This beach extends further to the
north and south, and a fair distance to the south you can see an old
lighthouse.

425.long:
Waves, their crests like white horses, hurl themselves against the
large rocks close to shore.  The breathtaking sight of the white water
spraying in all directions is reinforced even more by the roaring,
thundering sounds of the crashing waves.  Small crabs scatter as the
foamy water reaches them in the nearby rocks, but then chase right back
as the wave retreats, looking for food left in the wake.  This beach
extends farther along to the north, and to the south is a lighthouse.

426.long:
The construction of this structure is primitive, but was still done
with painstaking care.  Complimentary pieces of rocks were mortared
with a hard clay and then solidly stacked on top of each other.  The
building seems old and has doubtlessly weathered many storms.  A simple
wooden staircase circles up to the top, or you can leave through the
north door out to a rocky beach.

427.long:
Sizeable waves lift you up to the point where your feet can no longer
touch the bottom, only to drop you back down and recede away.  A very
big wave could easily throw you against the rocky shore, though, and
it isn't a good idea to stay in this area very long.  You can reach the
shore to the west, and although tall cliff walls bar your way to the
north, you can travel farther through the waves to the south.
427.item: where it shouldn't be.  Please inform the SysOp.

428.long:
The water is reasonably deep here, and is surging powerfully back and
forth.  Large waves lift you quickly up and down as they pass you on
their way to the rocky shore.  If a big wave should happen to break
here, it could easily crush you against the rocks.  The shore is just
to the west, or you can wade through more of this surf to the north and
south.
428.item: where it shouldn't be.  Please inform the SysOp.

429.short: ...You're in crashing surf, near jagged rocks.
429.long:
This is a very dangerous area.  Many sharp rocks, both large and small,
cover this area, and a very big wave could knock you senseless.  Large
waves buffet you around, and sometimes an unwanted splash gives you a
taste of the salty water.  The air is full of vapor from the spray of
crashing waves, and you can sometimes catch a glimpse of a tiny rainbow
in the mist.  More of this surf is to the north and south, and the
beach is just a short trip out of the water to the west.  Just east of
here the top of a large rock you can reach.
429.item: where it shouldn't be.  Please inform the SysOp.

430.long:
Waves relentlessly thrash you around, although you are managing to keep
undamaged.  A big one will surely do you in, though.  A cliff rises to
the south, but you can wade through more of this turbulent water to the
north.  To the west, a lighthouse stands atop a rocky platform, making
it impossible to reach the shore from here.
430.item: where it shouldn't be.  Please inform the SysOp.

431.long:
Above you and to the west, waves slide silently across the surface of
the water, eventually breaking on the shore in a tempest of white.
Many large rocks, the size of boulders, cover the floor, although
the rest is soft sand.  The tidal surge pulls you in one direction and
then pushes you in another, requiring you to concentrate to avoid being
hurled against some of the larger rocks.  To the north is one great
wall of solid rock, one of the cliffs which form the perimeter of this
bay.  To the south is more of this shallow water, but deeper, to the
east, begins a coral reef.

433.long:
Below you, an uncountable number of creatures are having a feast.  Tiny
corals which both build and cover the surface of the reef, continue to
methodically catch their food with small extended tendrils.  Several
starfish are also here, preying in turn upon the coral, and engaged in
a feast of their own.  Tropical fish dart all around, collectively
forming a constant background of whirling color.  Solid walls of coral
block your way to the north and east, but a swim to the south will take
you to more of this reef, and far west is shore.

434.long:
All the sounds of the ocean above are silent, save for the distant
muffled roaring of the waves.  Looking up and to the west, you can see
the ocean waves travel across the surface and toward the shore.  The
water temperature is comfortable and warm, and you have no discernable
weight.  In one word, this place is relaxing.  The ocean floor is a
mixture of sand and rocks, and like areas are to the north and south.
Coral starts to form just a few feet to the west, and going in that
direction will take you to an entire reef.

435.long:
Fish of nearly every shape, size, and color decorate this reef.
Beneath you, a carpet of coral covers the ocean floor, its vibrant
colors varying from a crimson red to ivory white.  A couple of dragon
wrasse are swimming nearby, looking like wayward strips of colorful
cloth, suddenly come alive.  A good swim west will take you to shore.
All other directions lead to other areas of this colorful reef.

436.long:
A large pinnacle of coral begins here, and rises up almost halfway to
the surface.  A number of sea creatures have made their homes in this
place.  Sea urchins and anemones cling to the sides, and in one place,
just under the surface of the coral, the tentacle of an octopus is
visible.  Other areas of the reef are accessible to the south, east,
and west, or you can swim up to see the top of this coral column.

437.long:
This is the top of a large coral pinnacle, which grows adjacent to the
northeast side of the bay.  This structure houses many small creatures
of the sea, including several spiny sea urchins and sponges.  In one
small cavity near the very top, a lobster has settled down to sleep for
the day.  You can head down to the bottom of this pinnacle, or swim
south, east, or west into other sections of this bay.

438.long:
This area of the reef is mostly dominated by groupers, sunfish, and
generally the larger varieties of tropical fish.  Sometimes a school of
small ones will pass by, several of them invariably falling prey to the
larger fish.  To the south, through the clear blue water, the bow of a
sunken ship is visible.  The reef ends to the north and east as it
reaches the perimeter of the bay, but you can reach more of it to the
west.

439.long:
Almost weightless, you half stand and half float atop the sandy ocean
bottom.  The side of a large rock extends all the way above the surface
of the water here, and you could easily climb up to the top.  Above
you, white disturbances in the surface mark the passage of waves on
their way to the shore.  The force of the waves pushes you back and
forth, even at this depth, and you are hard pressed to keep from being
thrown against the rock.  To the north is another area much like this
one, and a coral reef begins to the east and south.  Heading to the
west will take you out of the water into breaking waves, and eventually
all the way to shore.

441.long:
Schools of small tropical fish give you a wide berth, but some of the
braver ones swim near to get a better look at you.  Many of these are
angelfish, almost invisible when swimming straight toward you, but
reappearing suddenly when they turn and show their flat sides.  The
hard coral below you ends toward the west, but stretches on in all
other directions.

442.long:
This region is filled with hungry little cleaner fish.  Some of them
are eating directly off of the coral, but most are feeding on the
parasites which collect around the mouths of other fish.  As you watch,
one cleaned fish swims away, and the cleaner fish wait around.  In a
few moments, another large fish swims into place and the cleaners go at
it again.  Service with a smile, it seems.  A kelp forest begins to the
east, and the reef continues in all other directions.

443.long:
This piece of the reef grows in fairly shallow water.  The water
temperature is warm, and very comfortable.  The tidal surge drags you
back and forth as, above the surface, waves pass on their way to break
on the shoreline.  The coral here is sturdy, though, and you use it as
a handhold to keep from getting tossed about.  You can head up out of
the water and into the breaking surf to the west, north to a large rock
jutting out of the bay, or into less turbulent areas of the reef to the
south and east.

444.long:
Large boulders of coral occupy much of this area.  Each one, a home for
many small sea creatures.  Upon closer inspection, you can often spot
small shrimp, fish, and octopi hiding underneath the coral surface of
the boulders.  The coral reef continues in all directions.  Off to the
east, you can see the port side of a sunken ship, the hole which caused
it to sink visible even at this distance.

445.long:
Although still much covered with coral, the ground here is even more
populated with sea anemones.  Their somewhat translucent, multi colored
tendrils extend a few inches up off of the sea floor, waving back and
forth in the undercurrents and questing for food.  Some small fish have
become immune to the poison tendrils and use the sea anemones as homes,
well guarded there against larger predators.  This place is on the
south perimeter of the bay, and available exits are only to the north
and east.

446.long:
A large school of butterfly fish seem to favor this area, filling the
area with a confetti of vibrant yellow.  All of them are swimming in
different directions, and you can't figure out how they keep from
running into each other.  A red carpet of coral extends in every
direction, inviting you to explore other areas.

447.long:
The coral in this area is completely white.  Although white coral isn't
uncommon in the reef aside shades of red, you've never seen it all in
one spot like this.  Perhaps this particular variety of coral refuses
to coexist with the rest, but true or not, it remains another mystery
of the ocean.  You can reach more of this reef in any direction.

448.long:
A small cave is set into the giant wall of coral that forms part of the
south perimeter of this bay, here.  The cave is not large enough to
enter into, but looking inside, you can see a couple of sea urchins and
trumpetfish that are using the place as a hideout from the multitudes
of fish swimming outside.  You can leave this place by swimming to
either the north or east.

449.long:
You have moved into a small canyon made of coral.  Only about ten feet
above you is the top of the canyon, and here at the bottom, the ocean
floor is covered with only sand.  The canyon runs west and east for
about forty feet, and is just wide enough for you to swim in.  The
walls of the canyon are lined with coral, no doubt the hiding places
of some small octopi or eels.  This is part of the south perimeter of
the bay, so movement to the south isn't possible, but all other ways
out look viable.

450.long:
Sponges of all different sizes and colors have clustered around this
area.  Sponges eat by passing water through their porous bodies,
filtering out what they need, and letting the rest pass through.  In
light of this, it is strange to see so many sharing the same place, but
they probably have their reasons.  The stern of a sunken vessel is just
off north, and you can also parallel the wall of coral on the south to
the west.

451.long:
Giant sea kelp grows here in mass quantities, the sturdy leaves growing
impossibly high toward the surface.  No coral can be seen on the sandy
floor, but tropical fish are still all around.  Although easily light
enough to see, you gather that the plants get most of their sunlight
farther up near the surface.  A rocky wall rises up to the south,
forming part of the south perimeter of the bay, but all other exits are
unblocked.

452.long:
Strong strands of giant kelp sprout everywhere from the sandy ocean
floor.  Although still in the bay, there are no signs of tropical fish
present, and with that observation you also note that the water has
grown cooler.  Many small, less brilliantly colored fish are here,
though, and are busy feeding from the surfaces of the leaves of kelp.
A large rock wall prevents heading to the south, but you can proceed in
any other direction.

453.long:
Black, spiny sea urchins cover nearly the entire area, making a large
clearing in this leafy forest.  To the west you can make out the
starboard side of a sunken ship set into the coral reef, but visibility
in all other directions is blocked by huge strands of sea kelp.  Many
tropical fish are around, but not nearly as many as off to the west.
453.item: on top of the spiny arms of sea urchins.

454.long:
Pillars of kelp, each more than a foot in diameter reach up toward the
surface.  The kelp and you sway together slowly to the east and west,
as large waves from the open ocean enter the bay.  The surges to the
west are much cooler, perhaps accounting for the sudden scarcity of
tropical fish.  A large rock wall, part of the cliffs which surround
the bay, blocks you to the north, but you can swim unrestricted in any
other direction.

455.long:
Thick, rubbery leaves of giant kelp ascend upwards, questing sunlight.
The stalks of these plants are extremely strong, but are still often
torn by the power of the ocean to wash up on shore.  These healthy
greenish yellow plants do not seem to bear much resemblance to those
dead, orange husks on shore, though.  Some tropical fish are swimming
around, but a breed of cleaner fish the same color as the kelp are the
most popular, constantly feeding off of the rubbery leaves.

456.short: ...You're on the starboard side of a sunken galleon.
456.long:
This ship has long since been deserted by its original crew.  The
wooden exterior of the ship is still very much intact, and seems to
have held up well against the slow assault of ocean lifeforms.  The
ship was bearing north when it sank, and so the bow of the ship is in
that direction.  The stern is likewise to the south, and you can reach
the center of the vessel to the west.  Looking eastward, you can see
the beginnings of a thick forest of giant kelp.

457.short: ...You're on the bow of a sunken galleon.
457.long:
This was once a great sailing craft.  Mounted on the outside, facing
front, hangs a majestic figurehead which depicts a jumping dolphin.
Although much of the ship seems to have been looted, the large wooden
steering wheel is still present.  You wonder what the name of this
grand ship might have been, but the only clue to that seems to be the
figurehead.  The port and starboard sides are to the west and east,
respectively, and the center of the ship is just south.  Northward is a
colorful coral reef.

458.long:
This is the center of the ship.  A small building rises up from the
deck at this point and inside, you can see a stairway leading down to
the lower decks of the ship.  To either side of you, thick masts rise
upwards from the surface of the ship.  Both masts are unbroken and
still sturdy looking, but the ropes and sails which once hung on them
are long since gone.  The bow of the ship is just to the north, and the
other sides of the ship are reachable in any other direction.

459.short: ...You're on the aft side of a sunken galleon.
459.long:
A large anchor is still lashed here, a heavy chain wound many times
around it for storage.  Several large barrels are also tied to the
sides, which once may have contained food or stores of fresh water.
Barnacles and algae cover almost the entire surface of the slowly
decaying ship, but the structure still seems sound.  The port and
starboard sides are east and west, respectively, and the center of the
craft is just north.  Southward, you can swim into the wonders of a
coral reef.

460.short: ...You're on the port side of a sunken galleon.
460.long:
Below you, on the side of the ship, lies the culprit.  An enormous
hole was torn into the ship, flooding the lower decks with water and
quickly sinking her.  Looking at the hole and the bearing of the ship,
you can almost re-enact the scene.  The ship came into the bay too
close to the southeast entrance and ran into the rocks there.  Yet,
looking on the deck, you still see the lifeboat lashed fast to the
side.  The crewmen should have had time to use it, even with a hole
this big.  The prow of the ship is northward, and likewise the aft side
is just south.  East will take you to the center of this vessel, and a
coral see lies to the west.

461.long:
These were once the main storage areas of the ship.  This particular
section looks as if it was used as the kitchen.  The light is somewhat
dim in here, but still enough to see.  Many tropical fish are swimming
here, and through the opening just above, at the top of the staircase.
You can see more of this level to the west and south.

462.long:
This place was probably the crewman's sleeping area.  Several bunk
beds are set into the sides of the walls of this room.  In the middle
of the room, a large hole has been torn in the floorboards and makes an
entrance to the lower hull of the ship.  It is much darker down there,
and the thought of heading down there causes the hairs on the back of
your neck to do jumping jacks.  Other sections of these lower storage
areas are to the north and west.

463.long:
A large hole in the ship's side, just above you, provides enough light
to see.  Tropical fish swim in and out of the large opening, seemingly
unaffected by the ominous atmosphere of this place.  This area looks
like it might have housed the captain's quarters, but the damage makes
it difficult to tell.  You can proceed through this dimly lit place to
the south and east.

464.long:
This area was probably used mainly as a storage area and little else.
Barrels and crates lie strewn around, their contents since emptied by
looters or perhaps hungry fish.  A skeleton lies on the floorboards
here, near the corner.  Whether it was a crewman or perhaps an unlucky
sightseer like you is not readily apparent, but it makes you somewhat
anxious to be out of this place.  Exits are off to the north and east.

465.long:
The light is poor and the dimensions of this place are indistinct.  The
water smells of death and decay, and the natural silence of the water
only adds to the eerie feel of this area.  The only exit is to the
south, and the light coming from the hole in the ceiling there almost
seems to beckon to you.

466.long:
It is just barely light enough to see.  Shadows and indistinct blurs
fill your vision.  Every now and then you think you catch movement out
of the corner of your eye, but it is difficult to tell.  None of the
tropical fish which swim the upper decks are present here, and the
place seems suddenly cold and threatening.  You can head deeper into
this near darkness to the north, or go back up into the light.

467.long:
This is the north side of a channel which connects the warm waters of
the bay to the west to the colder ocean waters to the east.  You sway
gently back and forth as waves pass through this channel on their way
to the distant shore.  Many large, jagged rocks line the bottom of
these waters, and some of them will give larger ships some trouble
should they try to enter or exit the bay.  You can proceed into deeper
water to the east, into a kelp forest to the west, or into the center
of this channel to the south.

468.long:
The water is much cooler here, as the cold ocean water mixes with the
warm waters of the bay.  There is some kelp growing here, and even more
to the west, but the bottom is mostly sand.  This is the deepest part
of the channel, and possibly the only safe water for ships to enter
and exit the bay.  The channel continues upwards to the north and the
south.  The ocean lies to the east, and westward through a kelp forest
is a coral reef.

469.long:
Many large rocks jut up toward the ocean surface here, and will no
doubt unleash major damage to any ships which are unlucky enough to
cross blindly over them.  The swaying surge of cold ocean waves from
the deeper waters to the east can be felt here, making their way slowly
into the coral reef.  You can head into the center of this channel
to the north, east into the open ocean, or west into a kelp forest.

470.long:
These cold, deep waters are largely unremarkable.  The vast expanses of
blue quickly become commonplace, and the sandy ocean floor does little
to break the monotony.  The fish of these waters are large, and mostly
swim on the fringes of your vision, staying well away from you.  Every
now and then you spot larger shapes in the distance, though, reminding
you of the possible dangers in all directions.  A solid rock wall stops
movement to the west, but all other directions are unblocked.

471.long:

protected bay is just to the west.  All other directions lead farther

481.long:
Many white colored rocks and seashells adorn the floor of this place,
making a circle of white on the ocean floor.  In the middle of the
circle rises what looks to be an altar of blue coral, around which is
strewn many flowers.  Although unmarked, the area appears to be a place
of worship, perhaps by denizens of the ocean not allowed to set foot or
fin inside the city temple.  You can return to the open ocean in any
direction.

to break the monotony.  The fish of these waters are large, and mostly
swim on the fringes of your vision, staying well away from you.  Every
now and then you spot larger shapes in the distance, though, reminding
you of the possible dangers in all directions.  The city of Aquatica lies
beneath you, its glowing colors a welcome sight after your journey
through the surrounding void.
499.item: where it shouldn't be.  Please inform the SysOp.

500.long:

501.long:
These cold, deep waters are largely unremarkable.  The vast expanses of
blue quickly become commonplace, and the sandy ocean floor does little
to break the monotony.  The fish of these waters are large, and mostly
swim on the fringes of your vision, staying well away from you.  Every
now and then you spot larger shapes in the distance, though, reminding
you of the possible dangers in all directions.  Eastward leads farther
into the depths of the ocean, and west leads closer to the coast.  The
other directions head into other areas of this great void of blue.

502.long:
This is a lush, underwater garden, filled with colorful plants of all
kinds.  It is amazing that such beautiful flowers and foliage can exist
with such little sunlight, and startling that someone took the time and
patience to bring them all together in this place.  Several paths wind
through the garden, all of them heading northward, to a white gazebo.
South and east is cordoned off by the perimeter city walls, and west is
a solid wall of ice.  Other than the paths, the only other exit is up
into the open sea.

503.long:
You sit in a white gazebo.  The top and bottom of this structure has
been cleverly fashioned from the top and bottom of a giant clam.  The
pillars which hold them apart are made of a glittering white, abrasive
material.  All around the inside perimeter are benches for lounging,
and a beautiful underwater garden is just outside.  Other than swimming
up into the open sea, the only other way is to the south, where several
paths wind through more of the garden.

504.long:
This is a field of crops which the Sisterhood use to grow their food.
The subject of many attacks by Fire, this place will be one of the most
viciously defended parts of the Realm should another invasion come to
pass.  The green plants look in great condition, probably tended with
magic as much as with hard work.  Other areas much like this one are to
the north and west, or you can swim up into the open sea.

505.long:
This is a field of crops which the Sisterhood use to grow their food.
The subject of many attacks by Fire, this place will be one of the most
viciously defended parts of the Realm should another invasion come to
pass.  The green plants look in great condition, probably tended with
magic as much as with hard work.  Other areas much like this one are to
the south and west, or you can swim up into the open sea.

This is a field of crops which the Sisterhood use to grow their food.

507.long:
This is a field of crops which the Sisterhood use to grow their food.
The subject of many attacks by Fire, this place will be one of the most
viciously defended parts of the Realm should another invasion come to
pass.  The green plants look in great condition, probably tended with
magic as much as with hard work.  Other areas much like this one are to
the north and east, or you can swim up into the open sea.

508.long:
This is the courtyard of the Temple of Water.  As with most of Aquatica,
the only way out of this building is by swimming up and into the open
sea.  The temple is constructed completely out of what seems to be
solid ice.  Although the waters are cold, they are not so cold as to
keep ice from melting, and on closer inspection the walls do not feel
even slightly cold.  You can enter the temple to the south.

509.long:
The walls of this enormous room are elaborately carved with the shapes
of nearly every water creature.  Ice sculptures of larger creatures
also adorn the room.  The room is lit by several spheres hanging from
the ceiling, which are glowing with phosphorescent colors.  On the far
south wall is a giant shrine to Palani, Goddess of Water.  Every now
and then you see a sister enter, kneel briefly in the direction of the
shrine, and then return to her business.  You can leave through the
north exit into an open courtyard, or head west through an icy arch and
into the adjoining room.

510.long:
This long room houses an equally long, white table around which many
chairs are seated.  Although now mostly empty, this room quickly fills
up when lunch or dinner time comes around.  The ice walls of this room
have been carved much like the shrine to the east, but the pictures are
of historic battles.  A small doorway leads north into another chamber,
and beyond a large arch to the east is the main hall.

511.long:
This chamber is much smaller than the others in the temple.  The walls
are lined with books and a few simple desks provide a place for study.
On the far side of the room, the Abbess is speaking to a sister.  They
look up as you enter and nod courteously to you.  The only exit from
this room is through a small doorway to the south.

512.long:
This house has an open ceiling which lets in the small amount of
sunlight available at this depth.  The majority of the room's light,
however, comes from a phosphorescent paint, popular in Aquatica, that
covers the walls.  A great many weapons and suits of armor are
displayed about the interior of the building on stands and racks, and
all of them are in good condition.  As you swim inside, the
guildskeeper introduces herself as Marna and invites you to look
around.

513.long:
This modest structure is frequently visited by any who specialize in
abilities of magic.  Mainly a supply house for spellcasters, various
potions, spell components, and anything relating to the use of magic
are for sale in this place.  Also a meeting place for all varieties of
magic users, many also come here to swap stories and information.  The
walls are well lit with glowpaint, and several tables and benches lie
around for use by the patrons.  As you swim down in from above, a thin
looking man introduces himself as Arond, and inquires about your
magical needs.

514.long:
These cold, deep waters are largely unremarkable.  The vast expanses of

to break the monotony.  The fish of these waters are large, and mostly

you of the possible dangers in all directions.  Eastward leads farther

519.long:
These cold, deep waters are largely unremarkable.  The vast expanses of

to break the monotony.  The fish of these waters are large, and mostly
swim on the fringes of your vision, staying well away from you.  Every
now and then you spot larger shapes in the distance, though, reminding
you of the possible dangers in all directions.  Eastward leads farther
into the depths of the ocean, and west leads closer to the coast.  The
other directions head into other areas of this great void of blue.

520.long:
These cold, deep waters are largely unremarkable.  The vast expanses of
blue quickly become commonplace.  The fish of these waters are large,
and mostly swim on the fringes of your vision, staying well away from
you.  Every now and then you spot larger shapes in the distance though,
reminding you of the possible dangers in all directions.  You have
strayed so far out into the open sea that you have become confused as
to your current position, and you are not even sure which way is up,
much less north or south.  Any exit looks as good as the next to you.
520.item: where it shouldn't be.  Please inform the SysOp.

521.long:
The entrance to the citadel looks much like the mouth of a large cave.
Rocky and covered with shells of all kinds, the structure looks like it
could withstand a major battle.  Around the opening of the cave are
several whitish protrusions, which cause the entrance to look like the
mouth of some huge monster.  You can attempt to gain entry to the east,
or rejoin the blue void in any other direction.

522.long:
The walls of this cave are glowing with phosphorescent colors, and the
water here is much warmer than outside.  Many small fish, their colors
glowing like the walls swim in this cave.  The temperature of the water
and parade of colors makes this a relaxing area.  You can exit out of
this submerged cave to the west, or swim a good distance up and climb
out of the water onto the shore of an underground cave.

523.long:
This is an enormous underground cave.  The area is lit by a diffuse
light appearing to originate from the ceiling of the cave.  You are on
the edge of a shallow, freshwater pond, fed by a large waterfall which
cascades over the east cliff.  The sound of the thundering roar of
water is pleasant after the long silences of the ocean.  In the middle
of the pond is a fountain of three stone dolphins, spraying water in
all directions.  You can climb a winding trail up the cliffs to the
east, or descend into a small pool of salt water that leads to a
submerged cave.

524.long:
It is raining.  A neverending downpour falls from the sky, and collects
in small a reservoir on the top of this bluff.  The runoff heads over
the west side of the cliff and turns into a sizeable waterfall.  The
rain sometimes slows to nothing but a trickle, but just as it seems
about to finally stop, it nearly turns into a monsoon.  Another,
smaller cave begins in the east wall of this one, or you can follow a
winding trail down the west side of the bluff.

525.long:
This small cave, except for what seems a bottomless floor, is covered
in solid ice.  All the moisture on your body freezes immediately upon
entering this room, and you can not ever remember feeling so cold.  A
thin bridge of ice leads out over the room to the center, where a
pedestal of ice rises from the bottomless depths.

526.long:
Wooden floorboards support a stone fireplace set into the center of
this room.  You are only about thirty feet above the bay, but still
high enough for ships to spot you.  On the perimeter of the fireplace
is a large polished mirror, made able to rotate around the fire by a
circular track set into the fireplace stones.  A beacon fire, with a
person managing the position of the mirror, could easily be seen far
out to sea.  It is hard to tell if this place is still being used or
not, but there are no definite signs of recent activity.

527.short: ...You're on top of a large rock.
527.long:
Waves regularly crash against this rock spraying water everywhere, and
they are sometimes even large enough to flood the top with water.
Seaweed and algae cover this rock in several places, as do many snails.
Above you, the sun shines brightly with few clouds, making for a clear,
beautiful day.  The water on the west side of this rock is shallow
enough to wade into, but the water on all other sides looks to be over
your head.
527.item: on the surface of the rock.

600.long:
Two gigantic cyclones twist and writhe above you, marking the entrance
to the realm of Air.  The wind shrieks about you unchecked, pulling at
your body and mind.  You gaze up into the sky, and see clouds,
whirlwinds, and floating islands drifting above you.  Birds and
winged beasts move between the clouds, oblivious to your presence far
below.  To the north, a large wind funnel churns away at the sandy
soil.  To the south lies the Neutral Realm.

601.short: ...You are at the base of the whirlwind.
601.long:
A huge whirlwind spins before you, reaching far up into the clouds.
You can feel the powerful strength in its winds as they pull at you,
trying to draw you up into the sky.  Looking higher up into the
whirlwind, you see where the vortex passes close to some floating
islands, and seems almost about to consume a small cloud.  The winds
surounding you on this plane push you back as you try to move.  The
only direction they seem weaker is off to the south.

602.short: ...You are at the middle of the whirlwind.
602.long:
The whirlwind gets wider here, and bends off to the south.  The
winds seem strong enough to support you in any of the four compass
directions, and you see the whirlwind snaking up higher to the
south.  The wind's continuous hum begins to sound a little
hypnotizing as you listen to it.

603.short: ...You are at the edge of the whirlwind.
603.long:
You are near the northern edge of the whirlwind.  Bits of sand
blow past you, stinging whereever they contact uprotected skin.
The powerful winds of the whirlwind are all that suspend you and
the sand between the ground below you, and the clouds far above.  The
heart of the whirlwind lies to the south.

604.short: ...You are at the edge of the whirlwind.
604.long:
You are near the western edge of the whirlwind.  The winds buffet
you about, even spinning you completely upside down.  You wrestle
for control of your balance and your lunch.  You wish the screaming
winds would stop for a moment so you could regain your bearing, but
then you realize that they are all that support you here.  You feel an
extremely powerful wind pulling you skyward towards the
dangerous clouds, and the center of the whirlwind lays to the east.

605.short: ...You are at the edge of the whirlwind.
605.long:
You are near the eastern edge of the whirlwind, and are feeling a bit
dizzy from the racing, spinning winds.  Far above you, to the east,
you see an island floating serenly in the sky.  The underside of the
island is sandy and featureless, and you can't make out what, if
anything lays on top of the island.  The heart of the whirlwind lays
off to your west.

606.short: ...You are at the edge of the whirlwind.
606.long:
You are at the southern edge of the whirlwind.  The winds strain to
push you up higher into the heart of the whirlwind.  You see an island
in the sky above you to the northeast, floating peacefully in the sky.
The heart of the whirlwind lays to the north.

607.long:
Winds spin about you in rage, dwarfing you with their raw power.  You
can see nothing outside of this place in the whirlwind, and should
probably be thankful.  If you could see how you were being tossed
about, this far off the ground, you would probably feel a little ill.

608.long:
The winds tear at you as you move through the whirlwind.  The heart of
the whirlwind lies off to your east, and to the west, through a
strange, shimmering region, you see what appears to be a large tree.

609.short: ...You are near the top of the whirlwind.
609.long:
You are hundreds of feet above the sandy ground, and you feel a bit of
vertigo at the thought.  The winds still seem strong enough to support
you, but if you go much higher...

610.short: ...You are at the top of the whirlwind.
610.long:
The wind supporting you is weaker up here, and you realize you can go
no higher.  The sight of the ground far below you makes your head spin.
To the east, if you dare to step off of the whirlwind, is a floating
island.

611.short: ...You are walking on a small cloud.
611.long:
This small, puffy cloud drifts serenely through the sky.  A cool breeze
feels good against your face, and the air smells crisp and clean.  The
cloud extends off to the east, and the winds might support you if you
went down.

612.short: ...You are walking on a small cloud.
612.long:
You are on the east end of a small, puffy cloud.  The cloud seems
barely able to support your weight, but is managing it somehow.  You
see other clouds drifting far above you.  If you hopped on an air
current here, you might be able to reach them.

613.short: ...You are standing on a storm cloud.
613.long:
This cloud is grey and black, and you feel very uneasy walking on its
surface.  The air is quiet and still, but you feel as if the cloud
under your feet could erupt into a maelstrom at any moment.  In
fact, with every step you take small sparks flash out from under
your feet.  You see a smaller cloud far below you, and the thundercloud
extends darkly off to the north.

614.short: ...You are on the edge of a thundercloud.
614.long:
Peering over the edge of the cloud, the ground far below you seems to
cringe in the shadow of this thundercloud.  The power barely contained
under your feet could level mountains and raze cities, and you shudder
to think what it could do to you.  It is amazing how something this
soft to the touch could contain such a deadly force.  The air off to
the west crackles with power, and you feel a hot wind blowing from
it.  The thundercloud extends off to the east.

615.long:
The air here is charged with electricity and power, causing the hair on
the back of your neck to stand up.  Faint rumbles of thunder echo
across the sky like a deep, mocking laughter.  You've heard the
sound of rain many times while on the ground, but you wonder what it
would sound like if you were actually standing on a raining cloud.  Far
above you, in the heavens, you can make out the constellation of the
dragon.  There is more thundercloud to your south and west, and there
is a billowy cloud below you.

616.short: ...You are on a huge, billowing cloud.
616.long:
This cloud is so white it is almost blinding.  Looking around, you feel
as if you are in snow capped mountains, rather than far up in the sky.
But one peek over the edge of the cloud quickly dispels any illusions
about your location.  There is a huge thunderhead drifting above you,
and a smaller cloud below you.  This cloud extends off to the north.

617.short: ...You are on a huge, billowing cloud.
617.long:
The cloud beneath your feet is so white that is seems to be made of
pure light.  There is a surreal effect to moving around on the cloud,
as the bright and rounded curves add a dream-like effect to your
surroundings.  There is more of this glowing cloud to the south,
and, squinting up into the bright sky, and see a large cloud floating
high above you.

618.long:
This small cloud floats leisurely through the air, oblivious to the
world around it.  Birds soar all around, and you can see the tiny
shadow of the cloud pass over the ground thousands of feet below you.
It's so quiet and peaceful here, you are tempted to curl up and take a
nap.  There is a bit more of the cloud off to the east, and there is
another small cloud floating above you.

619.long:
Floating quietly in the sky, nudged by the winds, this cloud is the
picture of serenity.  The sky is clear, and you can see for miles
without anything clouding up your vision.  Below you to the south you
see a huge arena floating on a cloud.  Your little cloud extends off to
the west.

620.long:
Out of the corner of your eye you see a cloud dragon!  No, a bunny
rabbit!  No, a cobra!  You shake your head for a moment and realize
that you are just seeing shapes in the cloud.  But the cloud shifts so
rapidly, and the shapes seem so real, that you feel very disoriented.
Off to the north you can see some huge shapes swirling in the vapor,
and far below you is a billowy cloud.

621.short: ...You are walking across a cloud battlefield.
621.long:
Shapes swirl around you with staggering speed and power.  You watch in
amazement as the last battle of Earth and Air is reenacted again and
again.  You see Gotik the Earth King conspiring with Air to take over
Earth, Air invading the realm of Earth, and the forces of Earth rising
up to repel the invasion.  Both realms are laid to waste, taking
millennia to recover.  The last image is of Gotik being claimed by the
powers of Earth to pay for his treason.  You shudder to think at what
his punishment might have been for such a crime; Earth is merciless.
The shifting cloud extends off to the west and south, and a short
distance above you hovers a small cloud.

622.long:
You have to watch your step every moment here, lest you fall to your
death.  Everything on this cloud, including the portions beneath your
feet, is changing almost as fast as the eye can follow.  Small gaps
open in the cloud every few seconds.  Sorcerors, wizards, star-beasts,
and all manner of winged monsters rise out of the vapor to do battle
with one another.  When a beast is slain, it falls back into the cloud
only to rise again in a new form.  It is a panorama of the power of
Air, and a humbling one.  If any of these beasts were more than clouds,
you would not stand a chance.  You see more cloud formations off to the
east.  There is a cloud floating a short distance above you, and a
strong downdraft which could probably support you.

623.long:
It feels as if you are moving in a fog.  This cloud is so wispy that
you are afraid that if you sneezed, you would blow it away.  Soft,
white tendrils curl about your feet, and a thick white mist surrounds
you.  You can't be certain which ways lead off this part of the cloud.
623.item: that you can see in the fog.

624.long:
It feels as if you are moving in a fog.  This cloud is so wispy that
you are afraid that if you sneezed, you would blow it away.  Soft,
white tendrils curl about your feet, and a thick white mist surrounds
you.  You can't be certain which ways lead off this part of the cloud.
624.item: that you can see in the fog.

625.long:
This is the most fantastic cloud you have ever seen.  Everything is
perfect here.  The air is fresh, the sun is bright, and everything
feels wonderful.  There are eight other clouds like this floating
around, but none seems nearly as serene as this one.  You couldn't even
consider the possibility of doing something to disturb this
tranquility.  Far off to the south, and below you, you see a huge
arena on a cloud, with a large tower at the east end.  Above you
floats a fuzzy white fog.

626.short: ...You are on a very high cloud.
626.long:
Some masochistic streak inside of you causes you to peer over the edge
of the cloud, and you instantly wish you hadn't.  You are miles above
the ground, and you know that nothing could survive a fall from this
height.  It gives you a strong feeling for the majesty of Air, and a
strong desire to feeling something firmer than a cloud beneath your
feet.  This cloud extends off to the east, and there is a strangely
shifting cloud floating far below you.

627.short: ...You are on a very high cloud.
627.long:
The view is magnificent from this cloud, allowing you to see for miles.
You see a huge cloud arena far off to the southeast, and a rainbow
far beyond that.  There is some more of this cloud off to the west,
and, unbelievably, a tiny, wispy cloud above you.  Far above you, up
among the stars, you can make out the constellation of the archer
giant, locked in immortal battle with the dragon.

628.short: ...You are on a tiny, wispy cloud.
628.long:
There is nothing above you but an expanse of stars, shining and silver.
All the other clouds lay below you, many so far down that they are
nothing more than specks.  Few creatures can survive at this height,
and the ones that can are probably not ones that you would care to
encounter.

629.short: ...You are on the edge of the stars.
629.long:
You are perched on the edge of a vast field of stars.  The pinnacle of
the realm of air, this is the demesnes of the mightiest of Air's demons
and creatures.  Far below you, clouds drift in a field of blue, but all
around you the sky is black and cold.  The expanse of stars makes you
feel very small and alone.  You recognize a few of the constellations
around you, however, and that offers you a little comfort.  The star
field sprawls out to the north, and far below you drifts a tiny, wispy
cloud.

630.long:
Stars lend a pale glow to your surroundings, washing out the colors.
The stars are somewhat sparse here, but off to the west they burn much
brighter.  To your south, the stars thin out even more and draw closer
to the ground.

631.long:
You wonder if stardust supports you as you move through this starfield.
There doesn't seem to be anything at all under your feet, and it is
a very disconcerting sensation.  Far below you, the tiny glimmer of a
rainbow extends up to meet your eye.  The stars are more numerous here,
and you can feel their serene power as you move past them.

632.short: ...You are standing in a field of stars.
632.long:
Stars move around your feet, swirling and exploding.  It reminds you of
a huge field of flowers, but composed entirely of light.  The stars
here are cool, almost cold, and the light they give off sends a chill
down your back.  Stars extend off to the north, west, and east.

633.long:
The stars are bunched together here in a bright mass, making a
patchwork of light and shadow all around you.  Looking into the
cluster, the stars seem to pulse in a regular beat, like the heart
of a living being.  Stars lay about you in all directions, but to the
north the stars seem a little dimmer.

634.short: ...You are standing near a river in the stars.
634.long:
Stars flow lazily down a silvery river, lapping at your feet.  They
tumble and churn as they move along, and you wonder if there might be
any star-fish within the river.  In a few places, where the river
seems a little wilder, stardust sprays into the sky.  The realm of
stars lays off to your north, west, and east.
634.item: by the bank of the river.

635.short: ...You are standing near a pool of stars.
635.long:
You gaze into this pool of stars, and feel a bit dizzy.  Instead of
looking into a pool of water and seeing the stars reflected from
overhead, you gaze down through milling stars, and see the ground far
below you.  You wonder what sort of creature might dwell in this odd
pool, but your curiosity is not strong enough to make you want to take
a swim.  The source of this "star water" must be a fantastic place
indeed.  Far beneath your feet you can see an arena resting atop a
floating island.  A powerful wind blows up from the island, and it
seems strong enough for you to fly down on if you wish.

636.short: ...You are overlooking a battle of the constellations.
636.long:
The stars around you have been laid to waste by a colossal battle.
Gasses spin away from the dead husks of stars, swirling around you in
an eerie vapor.  To the east you can see the constellations of the
combatants, a giant archer and a dragon.  The star field also continues
off to your west.

637.short: ...You are in the middle of a battlefield.
637.long:
The power required to decimate this part of the star-field is
staggering.  Galaxies lay in ruins at your feet, their stars flickering
feebly as they die.  Other stars have been smashed or driven nova by
the power unleashed in this place.  The faint starlight flickers in all
the colors of the rainbow, making the battlefield an even more
uncomfortable place to be.  Off to the north you see the constellation
of the archer giant, and to the east is the constellation of the
dragon; the two beasts that fought on this very spot.  The battlefield
extends off to your west.

638.long:
The stars here burn hot and bright, writhing with heat.  The power of
the dragon is here, and the stars themselves burn more fiercely in its
shadow.  The dragon's power is the essence of the rampant, chaotic
power of Air and the mind.  There is nothing quiet here, nothing
ordered.  Everything is wild and unchecked.  To the west you can see
the battlefield upon which the dragon fought its legendary battle
with the archer giant.

639.long:
The stars here are cool, but radiate disciplined power.  The spirit of
the giant archer is here, dwarfing you in its presence.  The giant's
spirit is the purest form of the power of Air: tightly focused and
methodical.  To the south you can see the legendary battlefield of the
dragon and the archer.

640.long:
The stars here are ancient and dim.  Created at the very formation of
the elements, they were cast out from the pinnacle of the heavens for
their arrogance, condemned to burn out dimly from behind the rest of
the stars.  They whisper to each other in an archaic tongue, oblivious
to your presence.

641.long:
Dozens of minor constellations swirl around you.  A crab, a wolf, a
snake... almost every beast and demon is represented here, immortalized
in the stars.  Looking down below, you see the aurora borealis
shining like a rainbow in the night sky.  More constellations and stars
extend to the west, south, and east.

642.short: ...You are on the handle of the big dipper.
642.long:
A huge dipper floats in the sky before you, filled with a starry milk.
From your vantage point on the handle of the dipper, you can see down
into a fiery realm beneath you.  A gigantic volcano extends from a
mountain wasteland, spewing red lava high into the air.  To the east of
the volcano is an arid desert, seemingly incapable of supporting life.
Stars extend off to your north and east, and there seems to be a hole
in the stars off to the west.

643.short: ...You are at a hole in the stars.
643.long:
There is a large gap in the stars here, making it seem like there is a
hole in the black sky.  The hole retreats before you as you try to
approach, but you think it might just be an optical illusion.  The big
dipper is off to your east, and the constellation of the bull is off to
your south.

644.long:
The constellation of the bull shines brightly before you.  The size and
clean power of the bull are almost tangible, and its sharp horns are
something that would need to come in contact with your body only once.
There seems to be an odd hole in the stars off to your north, and to
the south there is a strange, shimmering gateway of stars.  Far below
you, you see a marsh and a vast ocean.  Under the surface of the ocean,
you see the faint outline of a sunken vessel.

645.short: ...You are on the foot of a star bridge.
645.long:
You are at the end of a bridge across the stars.  The bridge is
majestic, stretching off to the north.  Tightly bound stars form the
walkway under your feet, and your footfalls have a ringing clarity that
echoes across the bridge.  Some small constellations lay off to your
east.

646.long:
You are on a bridge across the stars.  Searing white stars are
compressed so closely under your feet, that you seem to be walking on a
bridge of pure light.  The air around you courses with power.  Ahead of
you, to the north, you see a huge pantheon.  The bridge leads off to
the south.

647.short: ...You are at the entrance to the pantheon.
647.long:
You are at the entrance to the pantheon of Zeus.  Monstrous white
marble pillars extend high above you, flanking the entrance.  The
floor is made of black opal, polished so brightly as to be as
reflective as a mirror.  Looking down into the floor reflects the
empty black sky overhead, and makes you feel as if you are suspended in
space.  A star bridge leads out of the pantheon to the south, and there
is a large fountain off to your north.  More of the pantheon lays off
west, and east.

648.short: ...You are in the pantheon of Zeus.
648.long:
You are in the southwest corner of the pantheon.  Huge, white marble
columns mark the perimeter of the pantheon, and as you peer out from
between the pillars you see nothing but brilliantly burning stars
below you.  The whole pantheon seems to float at the highest point in
the heavens, which is fitting for a place of this much beauty and
strength.

649.short: ...You are in the pantheon of Zeus.
649.long:
You are in the southeast corner of the pantheon.  There is a huge bench
here, cut from a rose colored marble, which must be Zeus' bed.  There
is a large block of marble, roughly the same height as the bed, sitting
in the corner, but you have no idea what it could be used for.  Out
between the pillars, you see a shower of comets streaking through the
night sky.

650.short: ...You are next to a huge mural.
650.long:
You are standing along the middle of the west wall of the pantheon.  A
huge mural fills the wall, depicting the majesty and triumph of Air.
You can see the archer giant and the dragon locked in their eternal
combat, each determined to slay the other.  You can see the rainbow
bridge stretching across the sky, gigantic thunderstorms, and monstrous
whirlwinds.  The scene is filled with demons and magi, in both combat
and study.  One mage in particular catches your eye.  Garbed in
midnight-blue robes with a bemused smirk upon his face, his brooding
eyes seem to follow you about the room.  Off to the east you see a
large fountain.

651.short: ...You are standing near a stream of stars.
651.long:
You are standing along the middle of the east wall of the pantheon.
There is a channel in the floor that is filled with stars, flowing like
water.  The flow of stars seems to come from a fountain off to the
west, and flow out of the pantheon to the east.  You dip your finger
into the stream, and it tingles.  This is the raw stuff of the stars,
you realize, flowing out to populate the night sky.

652.long:
You are standing in the center of the pantheon, near a fountain of
stars.  A dazzling stream of stars pours out from the fountain, and
flows off to the east in a small channel in the floor.  Looking up, you
see the pantheon is open to the velvet black sky, but there are no
stars to be seen.  You realize that the fountain before you must be the
source of all the stars in the heavens.  To the west, a large mural is
painted along a wall, and to the north you see a glowing white throne.

653.short: ...You are standing before a huge throne.
653.long:
You are standing on the north side of the pantheon of Zeus.  Before you
is a mighty throne, carved from a single huge star.  It is blinding to
behold, and you are sure that if you touched it you would be instantly
incinerated.  There is a large mural along a wall to your west, and
some statues off to the east.  To your south, a large fountain bubbles
with starlight.
653.item: near the base of the throne.

654.short: ...You are standing next to a mural.
654.long:
You are in the northwest corner of the pantheon.  A huge mural fills
the west wall, depicting the battles of Earth and Air in striking
detail.  The most recent battle was the mightiest, shaking all of the
realms with its fury.  You see the image of an Earth-clad King rising
against his patron Earth to help the forces of Air.  The depictions of
those battles stretch nearly to the ceiling, and are filled with power
and fury.  You notice, however, that a new space is being cleared for
painting, and wonder with a shudder if another elemental war might be
impending.

655.long:
Beautiful marble statues fill the northeast corner of the pantheon.
You see one of a pegasus, and another of an eagle.  In fact, the whole
range of Air demons is represented here, in this museum.  Each piece is
perfect in every detail, and you almost expect them to spring to life
at any moment.

656.short: ...You are on the edge of a windswept plain.
656.long:
You are on the edge of a featureless plain, floating high into the air.
To the east lays a small village, and to the west whirls the upper
reaches of a whirlwind.

657.long:
This is a featureless plain, and the winds howl about you,
blinding you and confusing your sense of direction.  You hold on
tightly to your possessions, for fear of them blowing away.

671.item: somewhere it shouldn't be! Inform the Sysop!

tightly to your possessions, for fear of them blowing away.  To your

675.long:

676.long:
This is a featureless plain, and the winds howl about you,
blinding you and confusing your sense of direction.  You hold on
tightly to your possessions, for fear of them blowing away.

677.long:
This is a featureless plain, and the winds howl about you,
blinding you and confusing your sense of direction.  You hold on
tightly to your possessions, for fear of them blowing away.

678.short: ...You are at the west end of Tempest Street.
678.long:
Tempest street is the only street running through this small, deserted
town.  The wind whips coldly down the street, which stretches off to
the east, further into town.  The buildings to your north and south
have no windows, and long ago lost their doors to the passage of time.
The grey buildings are both in shambles, and look almost risky to
enter.  To your west you see a sandy plain.

679.long:
You are in the middle of Tempest Street.  The building to your north is
the tallest one left standing in the city.  Its empty skeleton seems to
grin at you in cold mockery, and no matter how hard you try, you can't
picture this building ever being anything other than the husk that it
is.  The building that once stood to your south has collapsed into
rubble.

680.short: ...You are at the east end of Tempest Street.
680.long:
You wonder what happened to the residents of this city as you look down
Tempest street to the west.  While it lies in ruins now, this must have
been a beautiful place once.  But whatever life and energy once
filled this place is gone now, leaving only a husk.  There are small
buildings to your north and south, and a road leads off to the east.

681.long:
You are on a dirt extension of Tempest Street that runs to the east
and west.  The road is pock marked and rough, apparently once meant for
an extension of the town that lays to your west.  The surrounding area
is stark and grey, with nothing growing wild.  Off to your east you see
a brilliant rainbow.

682.short: ...You are at the base of a rainbow.
682.long:
The dirt road ends here, at the edge of this floating island.
Looking over the edge to the east, you are given a brutal reminder of
exactly how far up in the air you are.  The view is majestic, and you
can see for hundreds of miles across the realm.  Thousands of birds,
clouds, floating islands, and a huge rainbow fill the panorama.
There is a stone pillar here at the edge of the island, where the road
ends in empty space.  To your west, the dirt road winds its way into a
small, deserted village.

683.long:
This looks like it once might have been a spell shop.  All sorts of
spell reagents and books, smashed and useless, lay under layers of
dust.  Only a small crystal ball, of all the magical items, seems to
have survived.  You notice some black marks and holes in some of the
walls, almost looking as if a battle raged in this very shop many years
ago.  It must have once been a popular place for magi to meet, shop,
and trade secrets.  The only exit is to the south.

684.short: ...You are in an abandoned supply store.
684.long:
Shelves and cabinets lay in broken pieces on the floor.  There is a
faint musty smell, but you know that any rotting food would have
finished decaying long ago.  Sunlight filters in through some cracks in
the ceiling, illuminating the dust you stirred up when you entered.
There is nothing salvageable here from the store.

685.long:
You have no idea what building once stood on this site, but all that is
here now is rubble.  Dust and rocks are all you find after poking in
the ruins for a few moments.  Any secrets this building might have once
held crumbled with its walls ages ago.

686.long:
You are on the ground floor of an ancient library.  Old papers and
parchment rest on some of the few remaining shelves, but crumble to
dust at your touch.  Old desks and table are in pieces, but from their
numbers and arrangement, this must have once been a heavily used
library.  There is a stairway leading up into the library, and Tempest
Street lays to the south.

687.long:
You are on the upper floor of an abandoned library.  Most of the
shelves are still intact, even though their contents have long ago
disintegrated.  In its prime, this place must have been a magnificent
place to come and study the powers of Air.  It is a tragic loss that
all this knowledge, all this wisdom, has ended up as dust.

688.short: ...You are in a ruined lecture hall.
688.long:
Although grey and featureless, this hall retains much of its original
strength.  Once, magi must have travelled here from all parts of the
realm to study and practice with the powers of Air.  But now
overturned, crumbling benches are all that remains.  You gaze out one
of the broken windows, and can almost hear the arguments and lessons
that once went on here.  Tempest Street lays to the south.

689.long:
This grey building appears to have been a dormitory for students or
visiting scholars.  Stone beds line the walls, most fractured through
the years.  In the center of the room is a large wash basin, also
cracked.  The basin is empty, but it must have once held gallons of
water.  There are some messages scrawled into the wall, probably by
students, but some of them are in a language you have never seen
before, and many of the messages are just too faint to read.

690.short: ...You are on the red band of a rainbow.
690.long:
You can see nothing but shifting red everywhere you look.  The
color of blood, of apples, of rubies, and a thousand others all
swim before your eyes.  There is no sky visible above you, nor ground
visible below.  The color seems to change off to the east and west.

691.short: ...You are on the orange band of a rainbow.
691.long:
All you see here is the color orange, blotting out everything around
you.  The color does seem to change a little off to the east and west.

692.short: ...You are on the yellow band of a rainbow.
692.long:
You feel like you are drowning in a world of dandelions, or are staring
into the heart of the sun.  There is nothing but yellow in your
world.  The color seems to change off to the east and west.

693.short: ...You are on the green band of a rainbow.
693.long:
Everything is emerald green.  Above you, below you, and all around you,
green is the only thing you see.  Of to the east and west, though,
the color does seem to shift a little.

694.short: ...You are on the blue band of a rainbow.
694.long:
You almost feel like you are adrift in the middle of an ocean, with the
blue of the sky above you, and the blue of the sea beneath you.
Nothing but blue from horizon to horizon, but perhaps a slight change
in tint off to the west and east.

695.short: ...You are on the purple band of a rainbow.
695.long:
A field of violets littered with amethysts could not hold more purple
than this spot on the rainbow.  Everything is purple save for some
patches off to the east and west.

696.long:
You stand at the entrance to the land of spirits.  The spirits of the
dead flock here to dwell throughout eternity, reliving the deeds of
their lives, and basking in the glory of their service to Air.  To the
east stretches a huge rainbow, and the wail of screaming reaches you
from the south.

697.short: ...You are in the realm of the spirits.
697.long:
The ground is barren and grey, appropriate for the inhabitants
of this place.  Spirits of long dead warriors and magi whirl through
the room, lost in their own world of the afterlife.  Most seem to
ignore you, distracted by things on another plane of existence.  You
wonder what those things might be, but not enough to willingly join the
spirits who dwell here.  There is a large hall off to the east.

698.long:
This is where the spirits of the dead gather to swap the tales of their
former lives.  Stories of fantastic battles, former loves, and all
manner of adventures are exchanged in this room.  You hear the whisper
of dozens of voices even now, swapping their tales, oblivious to your
presence.  A barren field lays to your west.

699.short: ..You are in the field of the damned.
699.long:
A dank, vile smelling mist covers the ground here, and screams of
unending anguish fill the air.  All those who offended the powers of
Aerkos in life are banished here upon their death, forever to suffer in
the mists.  Shadows flicker at the edge of your vision, and the
continuous screaming sets your nerves on edge.  The torment here is
unbelievable... and unending.  The faint light of a rainbow reaches you
from the northwest.

700.long:
This place honors all those who served the cause of Air in word and in
deed, and paid for that service with their lives.  A small, grey altar
rests in front of you, and a continuous wind blows through the room.
The altar fills you with a sense of finality, and sends a shiver down
your back.

701.long:
A giant portal fills the east side of this chamber, and new souls pour
through the portal to populate this land.  You feel a strange tug to
step through the portal, as if it senses that you are not one of the
dead, and should leave this place.  A rainbow shines off to your west,
and exits lead to the north and south.

702.short: ...You are at on the edge of a cloud island.
702.long:
You are on the edge of a large cloud island.  To the northeast, you see
a large arena, and far to the east you see a tall tower being buffeted
by raging winds.  A bright pool of stars fills the sky above you, and
the road to the east leads through a large arch, with some strange
writing on it.  A shimmering figure stands beneath the arch.

703.short: ...You are at the entrance to an arena.
703.long:
A huge arena towers over you to the north, its white marble pillars
casting long shadows across the street where you stand.  This air reeks
of sweat and blood, and carries to your ears the screams and howls of
beasts within the arena.  This is where the mightiest denizens of Air
come to prove their mettle.  An archway leads off to the west, and off
to the east you see a large tower.

704.long:
The air is dank and heavy here, and it is a little hard to see things
clearly.  A stairway leads up to the arena seats, and a dark passage
leads north under the arena.  From the noises and howling you hear
going on around you, you get the impression that there is little or no
order in this arena, and that battles take place wherever two beasts
wish to fight.

705.long:
You are in the south end of the trainer's tunnel.  This is where the
combatant trainers ready their fighters for the fight above.  The
stench of sweat is strong, even though the tunnel itself seems fairly
clean.  There is a preparation cell to the east, the tunnel continues
to the north, and the entrance to the arena lays to the south.

706.long:
This cell is used to prepare combatants for the arena.  Here they
would ready their minds and weapons for what was surely a fight to the
death.  The cell is dark and cool, and you wonder how many creatures
left here to go straight to their deaths.

707.long:
You are at the north end of the trainer's tunnel, used by the trainers
and combatants to prepare for the battle in the arena.  A preparation
cell lays off to the east, and a stone stairway leads up into the
arena.

708.long:
This cell is used by arena combatants to prepare for the fight awaiting
them.  It is dark and empty, since the arena fighters probably need
little in the way of decoration.  The trainer's tunnel lays through the
door to the west.

709.long:
You are in the northwest corner of the arena.  Coarse stone walls
surround the arena floor, making escape impossible.  The sandy floor is
soaked with blood, and pock marked from thousands of mighty battles.
An iron doorway hangs open in the corner, revealing a stairway leading
down to the trainer's tunnel.

710.long:
You are in the northeast corner of the arena.  The sand is a bit softer
here, making movement a bit awkward.  You notice some large gashes in
the high stone wall around the arena, marking the spot where some poor
beast met its end.

711.long:
You are in the southeast corner of the arena.  The ground is dry and
caked with blood.  Over the south wall, you see the viewing stands for
the arena.

712.long:
You are in the southwest corner of the arena.  The skeleton of a dragon
lays half buried in the hard ground, almost fossilized.  The arena must
be considerably older than it seems for this dragon to have perished
within its walls.  To the south, beyond the high wall, you see the
arena viewing stands.

713.short: ...You are in the arena viewing stands.
713.long:
Dozens of rows of stone benches make up the arena viewing section,
which seems deserted of actual spectators.  Claw marks and a few
toppled benches indicate that several battles have taken place here as
well as on the arena floor.  The arena stretches out to the north, but
you can't make out much of what is going on because of the high wall
between you and the arena floor.  The viewing area extends off to the
east, and a stairway leads down.

714.short: ...You are in the arena viewing stands.
714.long:
You are on the east end of the viewing stands.  A few corpses are the
only things that might be classified as spectators here.  There is a
high wall between the stands and the arena, obscuring your view of the
arena floor below.  It was probably built to keep arena fighters from
escaping, but apparently did little for the popularity of the viewing
stands.

715.long:
Winds shriek about you in fury, almost obscuring your view of the very
ground beneath your feet.  The power of Air is intense here, and
everything else falls away before it.  The wind gets worse to the east,
and you see an arena off to your west.

716.short: ...You are flying in the howling wind.
716.long:
There is no ground beneath your feet, and no visible sky above you.
You are in the middle of a hurricane strength wind that howls in your
ears and threatens to deafen you.  This is the power of Air, raging in
its freedom.  You could manage to move off to the east or west.

717.short: ...You are at the base of the Citadel of Air.
717.long:
Peering through the raging wind, you see a high tower rising into the
air above you.  The Citadel walls are smooth and round, making it
almost look like a giant grey needle sticking point-up into the air.  A
raging tornado surrounds the Citadel, partially obscuring it from view.
The entrance to the Citadel is to the east.
717.item: somewhere that it should not be!  Inform the SysOp immediately!

718.long:
You are in the Citadel of Air, and you are yanked violently around the
room as you try to move.  Pockets of air move around you at all
different speeds, howling and shrieking as they collide.  When you pass
from one pocket to another, you feel as if you have been slapped.  The
walls seem to be made of wind as well, blowing so fast and strong
around the room that you cannot pass through.  There is no ceiling
above you, and it would not be hard to find an air current to take you
up.

719.long:
You are in the heart of a giant cloud in the Citadel of Air.  Some
patches of the cloud seem quiet and serene, others are black and
violent, ready to explode into a storm.  Some parts wispy like fog, and
still others seem big and fluffy like a pillow.  There is no floor or
ceiling here; you are supported by the wind.

720.long:
You are in the Citadel of Air.  Stars surround you, spinning and
dancing in infinity.  They cast their cool, pale light across the
chamber, washing out all colors to shades of grey.  A comet streaks
just past your ear, startling you.  The constellation of a dog rests
near you, some distance away, and you would almost swear it was looking
at you.  There is neither a floor nor a ceiling here, and you are
supported soley by the power of Air.

721.long:
Never have you felt the power of Air as strongly as you feel it here.
The air rushing into your lungs tries to burst them, and makes you feel
light headed.  A hurricane rages through the room, pummeling you
ceaselessly, and you have to squint to be able to see.  In the
center of the room is a spinning pillar of air.

722.long:
The main street of Helos stretches off to the north, between short,
brown walls.  Everything in this city seems to be made of the same
brown clay, making it seem extremely drab.  A small hole in the eastern
wall leads into a hut of some kind.  To your south, the city walls open
out onto a windswept plain.
722.item: lying on the brown, clay ground.

723.short: ...You are in the middle of Helos.
723.long:
A brown, clay wall lays to your west, stretching down the street to the
north and south.  There is a similar wall to your east, but there is a
small hole in it, which appears to be the entrance to a building.
723.item: lying on the brown, clay ground.

724.short: ...You are at the northern end of Helos.
724.long:
The squat, brown, unattractive city of Helos stretches out to your
south, west, and east.  A few people move about the city, ducking in
and out of narrow doorways, rarely speaking.  Everyone seems very
concerned with their own business with little attention to spare for
strangers.  To your north, the city gate opens onto a windswept plain.
724.item: lying on the brown, clay ground.

725.long:
The alleyway winds off the to west and south, set off on either side by
ugly brown walls.  Some parts of the walls seem to be crumbling away,
