and could use a bit of repair.
725.item: lying on the brown, clay ground.

726.short: ...You are in Amaranth's Shoppe of Mystics.
726.long:
The smell of incense is thick in the air, and thin tendrils of smoke
wind their way around your legs.  Shelves are lined with potions,
reagents, and an occasional magical artifact.  A faint, low humming
seems to fill the room, but you cannot identify the source.

727.long:
A wide passage winds off to the east and south, lined by dark clay
walls.  There are several structures that look a little like tables,
and it seems like it might be a meeting place of some sort.  You can
hear the wind howling from on the other side of the northern wall.
727.item: lying on the brown, clay ground.

728.short: ...You are at the end of a wide passage.
728.long:
A wide passage leads off to the north, lined by coarse, brown walls.
It ends abruptly to the south, but there is a small doorway that looks
like it might lead into a shop.  In the western wall, a small doorway
leads into a darkened chamber.
728.item: lying on the brown, clay ground.

729.long:
Benches and tables are piled high with some things you recognize, some
things you don't recognize, and some things you would not want to
recognize if you had a choice.  The air is musty and thick, and the
only light comes from a flickering candle on one of the tables.  The
only way out of this place is through a small door to the north.

730.long:
This hut is almost completely empty, save for a large, white pentagram
scrawled on the clay floor.  A few pillow are bunched in one corner of
the hut, which is where Hebezega probably sleeps.  A few wisps of smoke
are pooled in the domed roof of the hut, possibly the remains of past
customers.  A small sign hangs in the back of the shop.
730.item: where there should be no such thing!  Tell Sysop-studmo!

731.long:
The spirit of Aerkos, the patron of Air, is strong within this room.
The walls are colored a faint shade of blue, almost grey, and seem
brightly polished.  A breeze seems to continually move through the
chamber, making the candles on the altar flicker.  The altar is the
only real feature in this otherwise barren chamber.  A small doorway to
the east leads out into a passageway.

750.long:
Two monstrous pillars of granite rise high into the air, marking the
entrance to the realm of Earth.  Dust rises into the air as you move,
and the ground is cold and hard.  There is a cliff wall to your east,
which stretches off towards the forest to your south.  Through the
granite pillars to the north, you see Iron Street heading into the
city.

751.long:
Rising high above you to the east is a sheer cliff wall.  A short
distance up the cliff is a small ledge you might be able to reach if
you are careful.  The ground beneath your feet is barren and hard, and
seems to stay that way off to the west.  To the south you see a huge
forest.
751.item: near the base of the cliff.

752.long:
The ground here is grey and lifeless.  The soil is so deficient of
moisture and minerals that it has cracked open.  Everywhere you step,
a small cloud of dust rises up into the air.  The ground seems about
the same off to the east, but you can see a little bit of grass growing
off to your south.

753.short: ...You are standing in some sparse grass.
753.long:
There are a few tenacious blades of grass poking through the rocks
here.  You marvel at the strength of such apparently slender stalks
that they can split rock apart as they grow... but such is the power of
Earth.  To your west the ground seems broken and rocky, and to the
north it seems barren.

754.short: ...You are on a rocky patch of ground.
754.long:
The ground beneath your feet is uneven, causing you to stumble
occasionally.  Odd bits of rock stick out of the ground at strange
angles and threaten to trip you.  In other places, cracks in the ground
lay waiting for you to step into them and break your ankle.  The ground
seems a little more even to the east, but gets even worse off to the
south.  To the west, a narrow trail winds to the south and enters a
graveyard through some rusted gates.

755.long:
Jagged, sharp rocks jut out of the ground here, forcing you to proceed
slowly lest you fall.  There are several jagged cracks in the ground
here, and a vile stench rises up from one particularly large crack.
Off to the south is a dense forest.
755.item: lying somewhere it should not be.  Please inform the SysOp.

756.short: ...You are on a grassy patch of ground.
756.long:
There is a little bit of grass growing under your feet, and the ground
feels fairly soft.  The cliff wall runs next to you on the east, but
there is no way up.  To the west is a large rock that makes it
impossible to pass.  Off to your south, the forest begins to thicken.

757.long:
This ledge isn't very big, but seems sturdy enough to support you.  It
is partway up the cliff wall that is on your east side.  The cliff wall
stretches off to the south and north, but the only path along the wall
limits your exploration to the south.  You see a forest sprawling out
in the valley to your southwest.  You could probably scramble down the
cliff wall to your west onto the valley floor.

758.long:
The red rock of the cliff walls stretches high above you, and down into
the valley far below.  You tend to cling to the cliff face to prevent
yourself from getting vertigo.  There is an old entrance to a mine
shaft opening into the cliff to the east.  You almost missed it as you
passed by, and it probably isn't visible from the valley floor.  A
faint sulfuric smell comes out of the cave, but it isn't so strong that
it makes you gag.  Below you in the valley you see a large, green
forest so dense you cannot see below the canopy of the trees.  If you
put your back into it, you could climb up the cliff face to the top, or
scoot down to a small ledge off to the north.

759.short: ...You are at the top of the cliff.
759.long:
The top of the cliff is barren and rocky.  You won't be able to move
around much up here, as the terrain becomes quickly impassable.  Looking
out over the valley to the west, you see a graveyard off in the
distance, and a huge stone castle to the south of the graveyard.  The
castle appears immensely strong, but desolate and cold.  It would fit
in nicely as part of the graveyard.  There is a large boulder here to
the south that you could climb up on for a better view of the valley.
To the north there seems to be a large hole in the cliff top.  Down the
cliff to the west, you see a fair sized ledge you would probably be
able to stand on.
759.item: near the edge of the cliff.

760.short: ...You are standing by a large hole in the cliff.
760.long:
There is a deep hole in the top of the cliff, but you are unsure what
could have made it.  From one angle it looks as it if might be a
gigantic footprint, and from another angle it looks like it might be a
small crater.  There is nothing in the hole.  Off to the west you can
see the Gateway to Earth, and the huge granite pillars that mark the
entrance to the realm.  The cliff top is too rocky for movement to the
east or north, but you can move off to the south.

761.short: ...You are on top of a large boulder.
761.long:
This boulder rests on the top of the cliff, and offers a magnificent
view of the realm of Earth.  Directly below you, a narrow canyon cuts
into the cliff wall to the east.  And the mouth of the canyon, near the
base of the cliff, you see what seems to be a small village in the
forest.  The cliff wall continues to the south on the far side of
the canyon, and seems to run all the way up to a mountain range in
the far south.  The mountain rage is enormous, with jagged peaks
reaching far into the sky.  You can almost feel the tremors of the
quakes and avalanches that you can see occurring in the mountain
range even at this distance.  Deep into the mountain range, there
seems to be nothing but chaotic rock; the raw stuff of Earth.  Most of
the valley to your west is nothing but thick forest, getting heavier
and darker off to the south.  Far to the west, you see a huge stone
castle resting on a hill.  The only way off of this boulder seems to be
down onto the cliff top.
761.item: somewhere it should not be!  Tell the SysOp NOW!

762.long:
You stand beneath the rusted gates of a graveyard.  Ancient wooden and
stone markers stick out of the cold ground at odd angles, marking
scores of forgotten graves.  The beings here lived and died aeons
before your creation, and only the mists of time still know their
names.  The rusty gate creaks wearily on hinges, making you feel
uneasy.  You can exit the graveyard through the gate to the north, or
continue deeper into the graveyard to the south.

763.long:
To your west is a large granite mausoleum, its doors hanging open and
useless.  Its walls are decorated with the symbols of Earth, and it
seems to be a very strong structure, despite centuries of neglect.  A
faint wailing comes from within the mausoleum, but you are sure it must
just be the wind.  More of the graveyard lays off to your north, east,
and south.

764.short: ...You are at the east end of the graveyard.
764.long:
Many of the graves here lay open, making you wonder what became of the
occupants.  Small, brittle bones lay about the landscape among the
gravestones.  The air is as cold as the ground beneath your feet, and
you feel a chill run up along your spine.  This is truly a place of
death.  More of the graveyard lays off to your west.

765.short: ...You are at the south end of the graveyard.
765.long:
There is a crumbling gate here leading out of the graveyard to the
south.  The path leading out the gate winds up a small hill to the
door of a huge stone castle.  All around you are hundreds of graves,
closely bunched together to fit as many bodies as possible into this
small place.  There is more of the graveyard to the north.

766.long:
Thin streams of light filter through cracks in this huge stone
structure, showing you a dusty, eerie room.  One large stone casket
rests in the center of the room, its cover smashed in.  Whoever was
interred in this mausoleum must have been a powerful Earthen warrior to
deserve such an honor in death.  The rest of the mausoleum is bare,
long since stripped of any valuables that may have accompanied the
warrior to his rest.  The exit to the mausoleum is to the east.

767.long:
Candlelight from an altar to the east lights the room, and your reel at
what you see.  Apparently as closely as they buried people in the
graveyard above you, there still wasn't enough space.  You are in the
middle of what must have been a mass grave.  Rotting limbs and bodies
stick out of the soft earth walls.  The air is almost unbreathable from
the stench.  Half-eroded faces seem to stare at you with blank eye
sockets, pleading you to end their misery in death.  You momentarily
think you see some of the corpses moving, but it must only be a trick
of the candlelight.  There is a hole above you leading into the
mausoleum, if you care to climb up over the bodies sticking out of the
walls.

768.long:
There is an altar here, made from rotted human bones, dedicated to the
dead.  It stands about three feet tall, and about four feet long.  Two
candles burn on opposite ends of the altar, illuminating the chamber
with a shifting yellow glow.  In the candlelight, you can see dozens of
bodies protruding from the walls of the chamber.  From the positioning
of the corpses, and the expression on their long dead faces, it seems
safe to assume that they are not soothed by the existence of this altar
in their name.  But this is a true part of Earth; the closing of the
circle of life.  Bodies are forged from the stuff of Earth, and to
Earth it must return when life has ended.  One day you will also be
among the uncounted beings to whom this altar is dedicated.  The grisly
chamber extends off to the west, and you notice a large crack leading
upwards, but it is too small for you to explore.

769.short: ...You are standing before a huge, stone castle.
769.long:
You are on top of a low hill, the top of which is entirely taken up by
the monstrous castle in front of you.  It almost seems to be carved
from one giant stone, as you can see no individual bricks.  Perhaps it
was even carved directly out of the hill upon which you stand.  Its
high grey walls extend far into the sky, dead and silent.  The few
windows that you can see are all dark.  Looking down the hill at the
graveyard to the north, it seems as if this castle is an appropriate
guardian of that place, for it, too, is dead.  You can enter the castle
to the south.

770.long:
An inscription over the inside of the gate tells you this is the castle
of Gotik, the legendary Earth King.  It must date at least back to the
last war with Air, and possibly much earlier.  You are at the north end
of a huge hall, its vaulted stone ceiling stretching into the blackness
overhead.  There are no decorations on the walls of the hall, just
blank stone.  The hall extends off to the south, or you can leave
through the gates to the north.

771.short: ...You are at the south end of the hall.
771.long:
This appears to be the main hall of Castle Gotik, and your steps echo
loudly in this chamber.  The walls and air seem so cold and unyielding
that you can easily imagine this castle standing until the end of time.
The hall extends off to the north, twin towers lay off to the east and
west, and the throne room itself lays off to the south.

772.long:
You are inside the base of a tall stone tower.  Narrow stone steps wind
up the tower, and a large hall lays to the east.

773.long:
You are at the top of the west tower of Castle Gotik.  The air is cool
and stale, and from the dust on the floor, you would guess that few
people come up this way.  There is a map board here, with the map of a
small city etched into it.  Through the tower windows you can see the
raw forces of Earth raging in the west.  A narrow flight of steps leads
down the tower.

774.long:
You are inside the base of the east tower.  The smooth grey walls
stretch up out of sight.  You could climb a narrow stairway up into the
tower, or exit into a large hall to the west.

775.long:
You are at the top of the eastern tower of Castle Gotik.  Out of the
windows, you can see out over the valley forest to the east, and a
large cliff on the other side.  This must have been a lookout site for
the castle.

776.long:
Dark and cold, just being in this room makes the hair on the back of
your neck stand up.  There is a deep throbbing coming through the room
that sounds like a monstrous heartbeat, and you can't shut out the
sound no matter how hard you try.  The room is empty except for
one decoration: a throne.  Huge vines snake out of the floor to
surround the throne, apparently feeding it as if it were alive.  The
throne is surrounded by dirt and leaves, making it stand out even more
in this barren room.  At the base of the throne, a huge stairway leads
down into darkness.  To the north is a large hall.

777.short: ...You are standing among some small trees.
777.long:
There are some saplings here, and other small trees.  A fairly new
part of the forest, in a few more years the trees here will be as
strong as the trees you see off to your south.  A cliff rises above you
to the east, and to the west the ground is too jagged to allow passage.
To the north is a small grassy area.

778.long:
The forest here seems fairly young, though young by forest standards
could still be hundreds of years old.  Twigs snap under your feet
as you walk, and small insects fly out of your way.  There is a cliff
off a short distance to your east, and forest in every other direction.
There is a worn, wooden sign hanging on one of the trees.

779.long:
A faint breeze moves through the trees here, making a constant rustling
noise.  You gaze up through the branches of the trees into the sky, and
marvel at what a beautiful realm Earth can be.  Forest lays off to your
east and south, and there is some rocky ground off to the north.

780.long:
The trees fill you with a sense of peace and tranquility.  It must be a
wonderfully easy life to be a tree.  Most of the trees here seem
to be hearty maple trees, probably thick with syrup.  There is forest
off to your east, west, and south.

781.long:
You are in the branches of a large oak tree.  Most the branches are
at least as big around as your leg, and stretch out all around you,
as well as straight up into the air.  You doubt you would be able
to climb any direction other than down, however, as the branches
don't offer much in the way of handholds.  A tiny chipmunk scurries
by on a branch, and you wonder how many creatures make their home
in this one tree.

782.short: ...You are by a huge oak tree.
782.long:
There is a huge oak tree here, dominating this part of the forest.  Its
trunk is wide and strong, and it seems almost made of stone rather than
wood.  Its branches stretch like a giant canopy high above you,
sheltering the floor of the forest from the sunlight above.  But it
manages to soak up so much of the light, that only a few small plants
manage to grow at its base.  Forest stretches off in all directions.
782.item: near the base of the tree.

783.long:
Light streams down through the branches overhead, making shafts of gold
all around you.  Leaves crunch under your feet as you walk, sounding
almost as if you are walking on brittle sticks.  The underbrush is
fairly sparse, but seems to be growing well.  Above the treetops to
your west, you see a gigantic oak tree.  You hear some noise from off
to the east, and forest extends around you in all directions.

784.long:
This is the north end of a village of orcs.  Crude shelters hidden
among the trees are almost your only indication that this part of the
forest is different from anything else.  You feel the gaze of hidden,
suspicious orcs from behind several of the trees.  A cliff wall rises
above the village to the northeast, marking this edge of the forest.
You can skirt along the edge of the cliff to the north, or move into
more forest to your west and south.

785.long:
This is the heart of the village, and you see several large huts among
the trees.  There is a fire pit for cooking, and a large clear area
that is probably used for some sort of village meetings.  Off to your
east, you see a canyon cut into the cliff that seems to run along the
east side of this valley.  The village seems to extend into the canyon,
as well as to the north and south.  There is also empty forest off to
your west.

786.long:
This is the south end of an orc village.  Some small huts and shelters
fill a clearing, demonstrating the extent of the orc's construction
abilities.  A shallow pit behind one of the huts is filled with the
bleached bones of dead orcs.  They obviously don't treat their dead in
the same manner as humans.  There is also a water well here, but
it appears to have gone dry long ago.  There is a cliff wall on the
east, some more of the village to the north, and forest to the west and
south.

787.long:
You are on the east side of the orc village, just inside the mouth of
a canyon.  There are a few finished huts here, but most of the
buildings here seem as if they were abandoned in the middle of being
built.  The orcs probably started to expand the village into the canyon
for better protection, but changed their minds for some reason.  The
canyon walls rise to the north and south.  You can move deeper into the
canyon to the east, or out into the village to the west.

788.short: ...You are in the middle of a canyon.
788.long:
The canyon wall to the north seems to be a sheer cliff.  The south wall
is a little more sloped at the bottom, and covered with brush and
vegetation, but there is still no way you could reach the top.  The
canyon extends off to the east where it narrows a little, and you can
see the mouth of the canyon to the west.

789.short: ...You are at the end of the canyon.
789.long:
The canyon narrows considerably, and ends in a cave leading into the
rock to the east.  A hot wind seems to blow out of the mouth of the
cave.  Partway up the canyon wall on the north side, you see a small
tree growing almost straight out from the rock wall.  You don't know
how it got rooted there, but as it grows it will surely break off under
its own weight.  The canyon continues off to the west.
789.item: near the mouth of the cave.

790.long:
The vegetation and brush hide you thoroughly in this small crevice,
nestled in the south wall of the canyon.  It also completely obscures
your view of the canyon to your north.

791.long:
The trees around you are full of small creatures, running and
skittering out of sight whenever you turn and look.  Their
chattering fills the air, and they don't seem the least disturbed
by your presence.  One little woodchuck even comes up and sniffs
your boot before scurrying away into the forest.  Forest lays about you
in all directions.
791.item: lying somewhere it should not be.  Please inform the SysOp.

792.long:
There are a few pine trees here mingled with some oak trees.  Fallen
needles make a thick carpet on the forest floor, and the scent of pine
makes the air smell clean.  You see a number of pinecones high up
in the pine trees, but you don't have any way to get at them.  Forest
extends around you in all directions.

793.long:
There are a number of pine trees here, filling the forest with their
sweet smell.  Pine needles float down from the trees, landing on your
clothing and in your hair.  You see a large oak tree off to the north,
and forest stretches around you in all directions.

794.long:
Many of the trees here are have had their branches broken off, or are
actually broken off in their trunks.  It doesn't appear that they have
been cut, but rather snapped clean off by a mighty blow.  Jagged
pieces of wood cover some parts of the forest floor.  A huge, and
probably climbable, tree blocks any passage to the west, but open
forest lays in all other directions.

795.short: ...You are in a ring of trees.
795.long:
About a dozen thin spruce trees surround a clearing in the woods.  The
trees are thin, but very strong.  They almost seem more like statues
than trees, and you notice they don't seem to bend in the quiet breeze
that is blowing.  There is nothing growing in the clearing except some
short grass.  Standing in the middle of the ring of trees, you feel a
slight tingling sensation at the base of your neck.  There is forest
off in all directions.

796.short: ...You are standing by some broken trees.
796.long:
Most of the trees here are broken and smashed.  Trunks of trees lay
around you in splinters.  Leaves are scattered everywhere, and it almost
seems as if there was some sort of explosion.  A few trees are even
ripped completely out of the ground, leaving gaping holes in the earth.
One particularly large tree, that blocks your movement to the west,
appears to have been heavily burned.  You could probably climb your way
up the burnt tree if you tried.  Off to your south, the trees appear to
be in even worse shape.  You could also move off to the east and north.

797.short: ...You are standing in what once was a forest
797.long:
Not a tree still stands in this part of the forest.  The tallest stump
here is about two feet high.  Everything else is either broken apart,
or torn completely out of the earth.  There isn't even a large log left
intact.  There is nothing but mangled wood shaving and leaves where
once stood magnificent foliage.  The forest looks similarly damaged to
the north, but seems to be healthier in other directions.

798.long:
Several of the trees here seem bent and gnarled.  But despite their odd
appearance, they seem just as strong as their surrounding brethren.
One lone larch stands amidst all the twisted trees, looking rather
worn.  Forest lays all around you.

799.long:
The trees grow very close together here, totally blocking out the sun
in many places.  You feel as if you are under a huge green umbrella.
There is a fallen tree here, which at first seemed like any other dead
tree, but now appears to be petrified.  Toppled while it was still
alive, Earth refused to relinquish its offspring so easily, and turned
the once fragile tree into a beautiful stone that would last for
centuries.  Forest extends in every direction.

800.long:
The trees here are green and healthy, almost too much so.  You notice
that the ground seems to be dry, brown and almost like sand.  It is as
if the trees sucked all of the life from the soil for their growth.  To
the north, you see what appears to be a small village of some kind, and
off to the east the forest ends at a cliff wall.  More forest lays off
to the west and south.

801.long:
The trees here are almost like huge vines, growing right up the cliff
wall to the east.  In some places they dig directly into the cliff
wall, cracking it open in their pursuit of nourishment.  In some
places the vines are so thick it almost seems more like a jungle than
a forest.  You can move off to the north, west, and south.

802.long:
The trees here are extremely large, with their trunks almost as wide as
the span of your arms.  One tree in particular catches your eye, as its
entire north side is covered in a bright green moss.  The moss is
cool to the touch, and crumbles to dust under your fingertips.  Very
little light reaches you through the dense canopy, making dark,
strange shadows across the forest floor.  In all directions, you see
forest.

803.long:
The trees here are extremely large, blocking out most of the sunlight.
The bark on the sides of the trees is a deep golden brown, and is so
rough that it cuts your fingers when you touch it.  Far up in the
tree branches, hundreds of feet above the ground, you see some
strange shapes leaping from branch to branch.  The trees blocking out
the sunlight has apparently had a strange effect on the ground, because
it seems to be very soft and sticky.  Near the base of one of the trees
is a large clump of bushes.  Forest lays off in every direction.
803.item: somewhere it should not be.  Please notify the SysOp!

804.short: ...You are at the south end of the forest.
804.long:
You stand at the base of trees so large that they seem to be monumental
pillars rather than trees.  They are several times wider than you are
tall, and their tops are so high as to be lost from sight.  The forest
ends to the south with these behemoths, and runs into some impassable
rocks that rise up into a mighty mountain range.  Forest lays off to
your west, north, and east.
804.item: lying at the base of the gigantic trees.

805.short: ...You are at the south end of the forest.
805.long:
The trees here make you feel like an ant.  They tower up out of sight,
and must be centuries old to have grown so large.  To the south, a huge
mountain range rises up into the sky, breathtaking in its scope.  It is
a truly wild landscape, unworn in the slightest by wind or rain, and is
utterly impassable.  You can move into the forest to the north and
east.
805.item: lying at the base of the huge trees.

806.long:
Light pours through the entrance to the west, illuminating the mine.
Outside of the entrance, you see a small ledge overlooking a dense
forest.  This mine seems to have been abandoned for some time, but
still seems stable enough to prevent a collapse.  The mine extends
deeper into the rock to the east.

807.long:
Light comes in from the mine entrance off to the west, making it fairly
easy to see.  A piece of twisted metal catches your eye, and you
discover it belongs to the remains of some mining tracks.  Apparently
whoever created this mine used a small, crude railway system to move
things up to the front of the mine.  The rails are useless now, but
they must have once hauled a fortune in wealth from the depths of the
earth.  The mine moves deeper into the ground to the east.

808.short: ...You are at the top of a mine shaft.
808.long:
Part of a pulley system straddles a dark shaft leading straight down
into the ground.  Apparently the miners used this to haul something up
from the depths below.  It looks like you might be able to climb down
the shaft if you are careful... but it is pretty dark down there.  A
broken set of crude rails leads off to the west and east in the main
tunnel.  Light coming from the west is enough to see by.
808.item: somewhere it should not be.  Please notify the SysOp.

809.long:
A cave in blocks the mine tunnel that once led to the east, and you
don't see any way through.  You can barely see anything this far back
in the mine, and the only light that reaches you comes from somewhere
off to the west.  Part of an old mine rail system comes in from the
west, and extends under the collapsed cave into what once was the east
part of the tunnel.  A smashed mine cart lays on the tracks, beyond
repair.

810.long:
You are clinging to the wall of a vertical mine shaft.  A faint glimmer
of light reaches you from above; enough for you to climb by, but not
enough for you to really make out any details.  The east side of the
shaft does seem to be a little bit darker than the rest.  You can climb
up or down the shaft.
810.item: somewhere it should not be.  Please inform the SysOp.

811.long:
This appears to be a small recess in the mine shaft, which lays off to
your west.  It is almost pitch black in here, which prevents you from
making out any details.  You can just barely make out the floor beneath
your feet.

812.short: ...You are at the bottom of a mine shaft.
812.long:
You have to crouch a little bit to avoid hitting your head on the roof
of the tunnel.  The tunnel itself stretches off to the west and east,
and a vertical shaft stretches up into the rock above you.  There is a
deep, jagged hole in the floor of the tunnel, but it is too narrow for
you to explore.  The tunnel is illuminated by a faint, green glow.
812.item: somewhere it shouldn't be.  Please inform the SysOp.

813.long:
The main tunnel stretches off to the west and east, and a branch tunnel
winds off to the south.  Green patches of moss on the wall provide the
illumination here, and the odd light discolors everything around you.
The air is particularly stale here, and you find yourself wishing for
a cool breeze to pass through, which is a rather futile wish this far
underground.

814.short: ...You are near a collapsed side tunnel.
814.long:
The main tunnel stretches off to the west and east.  It looks as if a
side tunnel was once constructed that led off to the south, but the
tunnel caved in many years ago.  The rubble doesn't look that bad, and
you might be able to get past it somehow.  The tunnel is illuminated a
pale shade of green from an unknown source.

815.short: ...You are at the end of a mine tunnel.
815.long:
The mine tunnel ends here to the west, but extends off to the east.  In
the feeble green light you can see where the miners left off on their
work; the west wall is pock marked and chipped from digging.

816.long:
The mine tunnel extends off to the east and west.  There is a petrified
skeleton on the ground before you, barely visible in the dim light.  It
must have been terrible to die underground like this, knowing you
would never see the sun or open sky again.  You try to picture this
tunnel being the last thing you ever see, and shudder inwardly at the
thought.

817.long:
The tunnel ends here to the east in a dead end.  Mining was apparently
abandoned here for lack of anything valuable turning up.  The tunnel
leads off to the west.

818.short: ...You are at a fork in the tunnel.
818.long:
The mine tunnel stretches off to the west, north, and east.  This part
of the tunnel looks like it has had some recent use, as there are fresh
marks in the floor of the tunnel.  It looks like something, or someone,
may have been dragged through the room.

819.long:
This appears to be part of an underground troll village.  Small
recesses in the walls serve as sleeping areas, and small bits of bone
and rocks littler the mine floor.  The tunnel stretches off to the
west, south, and east.

820.long:
This appears to be the center of an underground troll village.  Some
large rocks are arranged in a circle in the center of the tunnel.
Other rocks and stones are arranged like benches, suggesting that
trolls come here for meetings or celebrations... although what trolls
would celebrate, you have no idea.  The tunnel extends to the east and
west.
820.item: lying near some of the rocks.

821.long:
The tunnel you are in extends off to the west, but ends abruptly to the
east.  It appears to be part of an underground troll village, but you
are not exactly sure of its purpose.  Huge blocks of rock, some
reaching almost up to the ceiling of the cavern, stand about the
chamber.  Many have been hacked at by trolls, but for what purpose?
Perhaps they were testing weapons of some manner, or maybe this is a
troll's attempt at sculpture.

822.long:
This cavern seems to have been hollowed out by trolls rather than the
original miners.  A large, flat rock fills the center of the room, and
appears to be a table of some sort.  It is littered with bones,
trinkets, and other unidentifiable objects, all of which have been
pounded into the rock table to prevent them from being moved.  The room
is dark, and the air smells thick and rotten, which is probably how the
trolls like it.  The only exit is to the west.

823.long:
The ceiling here is very low in some places, and you have to be
careful or you might walk right into a low hanging rock.  It looks as
if the ceiling started to collapse here, and you hope that it doesn't
finish while you are standing here.  The tunnel stretches off to the
north and south.

824.short: ...You are standing next to a broken wall.
824.long:
It appears that someone tried to construct a rock wall to block the
tunnel here.  Huge rocks and boulders were pounded into making a
massive wall stretching from floor to ceiling.  There is a large hole
in the wall leading off to the east, and from the looks of the debris
around you, whatever smashed through this wall came from that
direction.  You examine part of the wall that is still standing, and
discover that you can't knock a single stone loose no matter how hard
you try.  Whatever knocked a hole in the wall must have been immensely
powerful.  The tunnel also leads off to the west.

825.long:
Most of this cavern is burnt and scarred with heat.  In some places it
even appears that some of the rocks were melted!  The scorch marks are
everywhere, including the ceiling.  The only exit from this chamber
appears to be to the west, through a hole in a stone wall.

826.long:
The walls of the cave are burnt, and pitted with deep scratches.  Small
bits of bone are strewn about the cavern, and the air is thick with the
smell of brimstone and poisonous gasses.  Heat from the cave walls eats
at your skin, making you distinctly uncomfortable.  A feeling of death
surrounds you, and you are sure that for many beings, this cave was
the last thing they ever saw.  A large hole extends off to the north,
and the cave continues to the east.

827.long:
You can barely breathe here, as the air is so thick and hot.  You gag
from the smell of sulfur, barely keeping your stomach under control.
The Lair is fairly narrow, and on the north end there is a deep recess
clawed into the rock floor.  It appears to be the resting spot of a
large dragon.  There are dozens of spots of dried blood on the cavern
floor, as well as the remains of hundreds of dragon dinners.  The only
exit from this dragon's domicile lays to the south.

828.long:
The floor of the passage is fairly smooth, but you have no trouble
keeping your balance.  Off to your west, the passage rises into a
chamber giving off a rotting, burning smell.  To your east, the passage
continues to slope deeper into the earth.  Rocks have been broken off
of both the walls and ceiling, and it does not seem like they collapsed
naturally.

829.short: ...You are at a bend in the passage.
829.long:
The cavern bends off to the west and south here.  The rocks seem wet,
and as you touch them with your hand you are surprised to find that
they are completely dry.  Looking closer, there are small, shiny
crystals in the rocks that give the appearance of glistening water.
The whole effect makes you feel a little thirsty.

830.long:
A cold wind whips through this part of the cave, and around some rock
formations, making an eerie howling sound.  It sounds like the forlorn
cry of a dog, and you wait expectantly for the howl to stop; but it
never does.  The howling continues without pause, and you desperately
wish it would cease.  Passages lead off in all four directions.
830.item: lying by some of the formations.

831.short: ...You are at the bottom of a well.
831.long:
Above you there is a dark, round shaft leading straight up.  It is too
thin for you to fit through, but at the very top of the shaft you think
you see a point of light.  It look as if it might be a forgotten well
that ran dry long ago.  Passages lead off to the west, north, and east.

832.long:
You feel as if you are standing in the heart of the sun.  Even in the
feeble light of this cavern, the walls shine a brilliant yellow and
gold.  If you ever doubted why gold was such a precious metal, all your
doubts are gone.  The simple beauty of this one colored metal makes you
feel as if you are staring upon a field of flowers.  If you could get
just a fraction of the gold you see around you, you would be wealthy
beyond imagining.  Passages lead off to the west and east, and a
strange, round tunnel leads off to the north.

833.long:
You feel really disoriented looking around this chamber.  Everything is
set at odd angles, probably from some underground earthquake.  The
floor alone is hard enough to walk on because of the wild tilt, but the
stalagtites hanging sideways really make you feel off balance.  There
are passages off to the west and east, and an oddly shaped round tunnel
to the south.

834.short: ...You are standing in an underground city.
834.long:
The inhabitants of this city perished ages ago when their city was
buried under an avalanche.  Either the rocks somehow spared filling the
entire city with rubble, or someone has been excavating the city while
it is still under the earth.  You can see the outlines of a number of
small buildings, some still partially standing.  An old street leads off
to the south, and passages lead off to the east and west.

835.long:
Once mighty stone buildings stand in ruin all around you.  No buildings
still stand in their entirety; all that remains is a shadow of what the
city once was.  All of the city's former strength was lost under the
force of an avalanche some time ago.  All the effort and skill that
went into forging this place, all the sweat and toil, was wiped from
creation by a casual shrug of the power of Earth.  Most of the roads
are buried under rubble, but you could manage one off to the north and
west.  There is another passage off to the east, through which you see
a faint yellow glow.

836.short: ...You are at the entrance to an underground castle.
836.long:
A huge portcullis, and the front wall of a castle cuts through this
cavern to the southwest.  Someone has cleared away all the rubble to
the front of the castle, but hasn't actually opened a way into the
castle yet.  It must have been a breathtaking structure before it was
destroyed.  The walls radiate the passive, irresistible strength of
Earth, and over its gate is the mark of Kormoc.  You could not imagine
anything that might have breached this castle had Earth itself not laid
it to ruin.  There is no way into the castle, but passages extend to
the west and south.  Narrow streets lead off to the east and north.

837.long:
When an avalanche covered this city long ago, it must not have given
the inhabitants much time to escape.  You see the fragile remains of
dozens of people crushed under rocks and fallen buildings.  You
cautiously touch one of the skeletons, and it crumbles to dust.  These
people have been resting in their city for the past millennium, and will
probably continue to rest here for ages to come.  A narrow street
stretches off to the south, a passage extends to the north, and an odd,
round tunnel leads off to the west.

838.long:
You are at the south end of the Hall of Earth.  The walls are a
patchwork of the facets of Earth; mud, rock, wood, grass, and dozens of
others.  The walls bend in as they rise far over your head, meeting in
a jagged, vaulted ceiling hundreds of feet up.  The floor is polished
marble, so shiny as to almost appear as a colored mirror.  The effect
of the hall is to make you feel as if you are on the inside of a hollow
mountain.  Giant archways of iron lead off to the west, south, and
east.  The hall itself extends to the north.

839.long:
You are at the north end of the Hall of Earth.  Walls of the raw stuff
of earth melt into an erratic ceiling high above you.  Gazing up at the
ceiling, you can almost feel the tons of earth and rock that it must be
supporting in order for you to continue to breathe.  It makes you feel
a bit claustrophobic, in spite of the size of this hall.  Large arches
of iron lead off to the west, north, and east.  The hall extends to the
south.

840.short: ...You are in a very low cavern.
840.long:
This seems more like a sewer than a tunnel.  The ceiling is low, and
you need to duck so you don't smack your head.  A dank water covers the
floor, reeking of decay.  Between sloshing through the putrid water,
and crouching over to avoid knocking yourself silly on a stalagtite,
you develop a distinct dislike for this room, and wonder how it could
even be in the same element as green forests and majestic mountains.
The tunnel stretches off to the north and south.
840.item: lying where it should not be.  Please inform the SysOp!

841.short: ...You are in part of an abandoned mine.
841.long:
This appears to be part of an old mine tunnel.  Decaying wooden beams
support the roof, and pick marks cover the walls.  The passage to the
north, where it seems the mine once extended, has collapsed.  It looks
like you might be able to move through the rubble if you worked at it.
The tunnel narrows to the south, and there is an odd smell coming from
that direction.

842.long:
Veins of assorted rocks and minerals streak the walls; catching the
light.  Hundreds of the streaks cover the walls, representing every
color you could imagine.  Touching one of the streaks, a bit of the
color rubs off on your hands, but doesn't stain.  You wonder how many
other beautiful effects like this lay buried beneath your feet, never
to be seen by human eyes.  A passage leads off to the east, and
an odd, round passage leads off to the west.

843.long:
The passage is round, and big enough for you to stand upright.  The
tunnel walls are wet and slippery, and the air is filled with the
smell of wet leaves.  Round tunnels lead off to the north, east, and
west.

844.long:
This cavern is very narrow, but stretches far out of sight above you.
Staring upwards, you get a touch of vertigo, and it is easy to imagine
you are falling down this shaft, rather than standing at the bottom and
looking up.  There seems to be a faint whistling sound coming from
far up the shaft, but you can't clearly make out what it might be.  A
passage leads off to the west, and an odd, round tunnel leads off to
the south.

845.long:
A stream of water falls from the ceiling in the middle of the chamber,
making a cool, gurgling sound that echoes all around you.  Spray
from the water fills the room, and makes things rather damp and
cool.  The water falls into a small pool in the center of the room,
about three feet across.  Apparently the pool drains out the bottom of
the cave, preventing the pool from growing any larger.  The sound of
the water is relaxing, and you wouldn't mind curling up here for a nap.
There are exits to the north and west, and odd, round tunnels to the
east and south.

846.short: ...You are in a cave of gems.
846.long:
This cave has been carved from the earth by something other than human
hands.  The entire cavern is like being inside a giant, multifaceted
gemstone.  The walls are jagged, turning at odd angles to make small
recesses in some places, and sharp points in others.  Every piece of
the wall is a different color, and is polished to a hard, mirror
finish.  Light seems to emanate from somewhere deep inside the walls,
making the colors shift around you, and making you feel as if the room
is moving a little.  Odd, round shaped tunnels lead off to the west,
north, and east.

847.long:
The passage is round, and big enough for you to stand upright.  The
tunnel walls are wet and slippery, and the air is filled with the
smell of decay.  Every few seconds a strange rumbling sound
reaches you from the east.  You notice the broken off blade of a
dagger stuck into the north wall, but you can't seem to pry it
free.  Round tunnels lead off to the west, south, and east.

848.short: ...You are in a cave of roots.
848.long:
It looks as if something burrowed directly beneath a huge tree, as the
ceiling of this cave is composed entirely of roots.  Most of the roots
are as thick as your arm, and a dark brown color.  They seem moist and
alive, but you are not sure where they are drawing their water from.
The tree they support must be immense to have such strong roots
reaching so far underground.  Strange, round tunnels lead off to the
west, south, and east.

849.long:
This is a large, cool cavern, whose ceiling reaches high up into
darkness.  Near the south wall, you see what appears to be the remains
of a campsite.  A small pit, full of ashes, indicates where someone
actually tried to light a campfire underground.  The ashes are cold,
and the pit is apparently fairly old.  Near the pit are some rocks that
were apparently used to sit on while cooking a meal, or tending the
fire.  There is a worn area on the floor near the campsite, which looks
like it could be where the camper slept.  There are some markings
carved into the cavern wall.  A passage leads off to the east, and
strange, round tunnels lead to the north and west.

850.long:
The walls, ceiling, and floor are all curved, and smell of damp earth.
You find it a little hard to breathe here, as the cavern is both hot
and humid.  You touch one of the walls, and find it distinctly hot to
the touch.  Perhaps the cavern passes near some underground lava flow,
but regardless of its origin, the heat is a bit stifling.  Odd, round
passages lead off to the west, north, and east.

851.short: ...You are in a an underground cave.
851.long:
Giant rock formations hang from the ceiling and rise from the floor
here, making you feel as if you are in the mouth of a large, stone
beast.  On one of the stalagmites, you see an human skeleton, impaled
through the chest.  He was probably killed instantly.  A passage leads
off to the east, and odd, round passages lead off to the north and
west.

852.short: ...You are on the edge of the chaos of Earth.
852.long:
A tunnel from the north opens up onto the small ledge upon which you
stand.  Looking around the cliff face above and below you, the cliff
seems to stretch on forever, making you feel like a tiny fly on the
face of a cliff.  You reel for a second from sheer vertigo.  Away from
the rock face, to the south, there is a cavern of unimaginable
proportions.  You can't see the top or sides, but can somehow sense
that they are there nonetheless, holding you in.  Only in Earth could
you feel claustrophobic in such an immense space.  In the middle of the
cavern, whole mountains whirl around the cavern, smashing each other
into rubble.  Geysers of dirt, rock, and mud shoot from every
direction, mixing and reforming endlessly.  The only thing not moving,
being destroyed, or being created, in this whole place is a fortress
off to the south.  Oblivious to the chaos raging around it, the
fortress stands on a column of rock that stretches down into the
blackness below you.  A narrow, stone bridge leads from the ledge
beneath your feet to the fortress, if you dare to cross it.
852.item: lying somewhere it shouldn't be.  Please inform the SysOp.

853.long:
This stone bridge crosses a gulf of Earthen chaos.  The cavern you are
in is dark, and seemingly infinite.  The only wall you can make out is
to the north, and the only feature on that wall is a small tunnel
leading into the cliff, connecting it to the bridge under your feet.
All around you, pieces of earth spin in an elemental fury.  Pebbles and
mountains alike careen around the room in defiance of gravity,
colliding in spectacular displays of power.  To your south, there lays
a large fortress, unaffected by the chaos around you.  It rests on the
top of a huge column of rock that extends down out of sight below you.
853.item: somewhere it shouldn't be.  Please inform the SysOp!

854.short: ...You are at the gate of a fortress.
854.long:
You are at the south end of a stone bridge, which crosses a chasm to
your north, and meets with an endless cliff wall.  The ground beneath
you is a stone column that stretches out of sight below you.  In front
of you, to the south, solid iron gates mark the entrance to a fortress
of overpowering strength.  The air around the fortress is full of
boulders, rocks, and other pieces of earth, flying around furiously,
but none touch the fortress.  Although it isn't physically that large,
it has the presence of an entire mountain range.
854.item: somewhere it shouldn't be!  Please inform the SysOp!

855.long:
You seem to be trapped on one large branch of a very tall tree.  There
are no other branches you can climb to, and no other trees close enough
to jump to.  As you look around, you catch a glimpse of movement out of
the corner of your eye, but when you turn to look it is gone.  You
quickly get the feeling that you are being watched.  Looking down off
the branch, there are some bushes on the forest floor that you might be
able to land in if you jumped.
855.item: somewhere it resting on the branch.

856.long:
To your west, in the cavern wall, is a stone archway through which you
can see a stairway ascending into darkness.  It is the only thing in
this place that doesn't disorient you.  You stand at the foot of
immense blades of grass, some over thirty feet tall.  They sway in the
quiet breeze just like the grass you have walked on all of your life,
but now you look up at them, rather than down.  Odd noises reach you
from all directions, and you feel as if you are in a large forest.  The
cavern stretches out to the north, east, and south.

857.short: ...You are standing in some giant grass.
857.long:
You are in the northwest corner of a vast underground cave.  You can
barely see the roof of the cavern through the giant blades of grass
that tower over you.  You consider climbing one for a better view, but
there are none that offer any handholds.  The sounds of insects
fills the air.  The cavern extends to your east and south.

858.short: ...You are standing under a giant mushroom.
858.long:
You are along the north wall of a huge cavern.  An enormous fungus
towers over you, emitting a faint odor.  The mushroom is a dark shade
of tan, with black specks on it.  It is soft to the touch, feeling a
little like velvet.  The cavern extends off to the west, south, and
east.
858.item: near the base of the mushroom.

859.short: ...You are standing under some large mushrooms.
859.long:
You are in the northeast corner of a huge cave.  Huge mushrooms tower
above you, looking more like trees than mushrooms.  The odor of these
mushrooms is a bit foul, and you can't imagine anything being
interested in eating them.  Some large blades of grass stick up around
the mushrooms, fighting them for the light high above.  The cavern you
are in extends to the west and south.

860.short: ...You are next to some broken blades of grass.
860.long:
You are standing against the east wall of a huge cavern.  Giant blades
of grass, many times taller than you, cover the ground.  They are a
deep shade of green, almost emerald.  A few of the stalks were broken
off just above the root, and the broken grass lays on the ground before
you like giant logs.  The cavern extends to the north, west, and south,
and a passage exits the cavern to the east.

861.short: ...You are standing under some gigantic flowers.
861.long:
You are in the southeast corner of a huge underground cavern, standing
beneath some two hundred foot tall orchids.  The scent of the orchids
is almost overpowering; so thick that you can almost feel it filling
your lungs.  You can hear the humming of several large insects off to
the northwest somewhere.  The cavern itself extends to the north and
west.

862.short: ...You are standing in some scratched earth.
862.long:
You are along the south wall of a gigantic underground cavern, among
some gargantuan blades of grass.  The grass is thick and strong, except
for one place where dozens of blades have been completely uprooted.
The rich soil where they once stood is exposed to the air, and marked
with deep furrows.  The furrows almost seem like claw marks, as if some
huge beast scratched up a patch of the ground.  You can move off to the
west, north, and east.

863.short: ...You are standing among some giant weeds.
863.long:
You are in the southwest corner of a huge underground cavern, next to
some gargantuan weeds.  A monstrous yellow dandelion towers over you
like a tree, its yellow flower looking like the sun.  Other weeds also
spring from the earth here, the smallest of which is at least twice
your height.  The cavern extends off to the east and north.

864.short: ...You are standing by a huge pool.
864.long:
You are in the center of an immense underground cavern.  There is a
pool of water here, surrounded by huge boulders.  You can barely see
the surface of the pool over the tops of the boulders, and the boulders
are too slippery to climb.  The pool bubbles and gurgles, and is
apparently being fed from an underground stream of some sort.  The
cavern stretches off in all directions.

865.long:
You are in the Citadel of Earth.  The walls are made of mud, flowing
slowly to the floor.  The effect is unsettling, making you feel as if
the whole room is sinking into the ground.  Sticky mud for a floor
makes walking slow and difficult, and huge globs of mud fall randomly
from the ceiling, making wet splatting sounds when they hit.  The main
entrance to the Citadel lays to the north, and doorways lead to the
east and south.

866.long:
You are in the Citadel of Earth.  Everything is a light shade of grey,
giving no feeling of warmth, life, or movement.  Touching the stone,
you find it is as cold and unyielding as the image it projects.
Doorways lay to the north and east.

867.long:
This chamber is the rich with the power of Earth.  The walls shake and
crack, crumbling to the floor only to be immediately replaced by more
dirt from behind.  The ceiling sags dangerously, but never quite
reaches the point of collapse.  You can feel the floor beneath you
shake continuously, as if in the midst of a perpetual earthquake.  Dust
fills the air, making it a little hard to see.  In the center of the
room is a pillar of stone, about four feet high.  You can leave to the
north and west.

868.long:
Here is the essence of the growth of Earth.  Moss grows from the walls
and ceilings, growing through and on thick vines that wind their way up
the walls.  The ground is a rich blanket of grass, trees, bushes, and
other life.  Everything grows at a phenomenal rate, then withers away
before your eyes to be replaced by something new.  Whole trees grow,
live, and die in seconds.  The vines writhe across the walls like
snakes, only to crumble into dust moments later.  This is the full
cycle of Earth, played out eternally.  You can exit to the south or
west.

869.short: ...You are in a city in a tree.
869.long:
Branches have grown tightly together in this immense tree to form
walkways and platforms for the people who dwell here.  The citizens of
the town move about on their business as in any other city, apparently
unconcerned with the oddity of living in a tree.  The trunk of the tree
lays to the southwest, and paths wind around the tree to the south and
west.  You can also climb up higher into the tree, or down to the
forest floor below.

870.short: ...You are in a burnt part of a tree.
870.long:
Some of the branches are singed, or even charred completely black.
Burn marks are visible on the trunk all the way down to the forest
floor below.  Whatever did this to the tree didn't seem to damage it
much, as the blackened parts seem no weaker than anything else.  You
could probably move up or down the trunk here, or go around the trunk
to the north and west.

871.short: ...You are in a city in a tree.
871.long:
Large pieces of wood are missing from the trunk of the tree, almost as
if someone was trying to dig a hole directly into its side.  The scent
of the freshly cut wood is so thick in the air you can almost taste it.
You could climb further up the trunk here, or move around it to the
east and north.

872.short: ...You are at an opening in the trunk.
872.long:
You are in a city in a tree, standing among the branches, near a large
hole in the trunk.  The hole seems large enough for a man to fit
though, and leads down into a dark hole inside the trunk of the tree.
You aren't sure, however, if you could get back out if you went down
into the hole.  You can climb further up the tree, or move around the
trunk to the east and south.

873.short: ...You are in a city in a tree.
873.long:
A small hole in the canopy of leaves and branches lets in a ray of
golden sunlight.  Where it strikes the bark of the tree, it glows a
rich shade of brown, making the rest of this area seem dark and dirty
by comparison.  You could climb down the tree here, or move around the
trunk to the south or west.

874.long:
Against the trunk of the tree is a large, wooden altar.  The air is
very still here, and smells like wet leaves.  Everything around you is
so vibrantly alive that it almost feels as if you are in the middle of
a living electrical storm.  A powerful presence emanates from the wood
around you, and you feel almost as if you are being watched.  You can
move around the trunk to the north and west, or climb down.

875.long:
The branches of the tree are covered with a sticky sap, which seems to
be oozing from deep cracks, right below a large knot in the trunk.  It
makes an odd sound when you walk, but doesn't appear to be sticking to
you permanently.  You can move around the trunk to the north and east,
and climb down the trunk.

876.short: ...You are in a city in a tree.
876.long:
Huge fruits hang over your head, dangling from thick branches.  The
fruits are of every shape and color, and look so good your mouth starts
to water.  You can move around the trunk to the east and south, or
climb down.

877.short: ...You are in the trunk of a tree.
877.long:
Far above you, light streams down through a hole in the trunk, but it
is too far away to reach.  The walls of this chamber are caked with
slime, and the floor is thick with garbage and refuse.  You are
apparently wading in the garbage pit for the city in the trees.  The
garbage slops against you, and the stench is almost overpowering.  An
inscription on one grimy wall reads "Once you enter, you shall knot
leave this place alive!"  For some reason, these words offer you little
comfort.
877.item: perched on the edge of chaos!  Tell Sysop!  This isn't right!

5000.long:
You're standing in the center of the city of Crossroads, at the
intersection of the town's main streets.  All around you, large brick
buildings rise from the paved ground, many of them covered and patched
with boards.  The cobblestones here are very worn, often tread by the
city's inhabitants.  A giant tower rises from the center of the
intersection, standing on four stone pillars.  Between the pillars
lies a slightly worn fountain.  You also notice a large, wooden sign
stuck on a post in the cobblestones.  You can exit in any direction or
climb the stairs into the tower.
5000.item: lying somewhere it shouldn't.  Please inform the Sysop!

5001.long:
You are standing just west of the center of town.  The road is paved
nicely with cobblestones, although there are a few suspicious potholes
on the ground.  To the south and north, your view is blocked by large
buildings.  The building to the south is completely boarded-up, with
all windows covered.  To the north, you see a window in the back of the
building, although it is too high for you to see inside.

5002.long:
You are standing at the intersection of two streets.  To the west,
Hades Street continues to the end of the town.  A small street
intersects this one from the north and continues to the south.  The
road here is fairly worn, with many potholes in the road.

5003.short: ...You're at the end of a dusty road.
5003.long:
You are just outside the city walls.  To the east, the city walls loom
ominously.  The bricks look very sturdy, as if ready to withstand the
longest siege.  The city gate is open, allowing travelers to enter.
Looking north you notice some trees that seem to be nearly dead, and
shrouded in mist.  The trees to the south are somewhat sickly, with
few leaves.

5004.long:
The air here is notably warm.  To the north you can glimpse some
unhealthy looking trees through the mists.  Southward the trees appear
dead and the bark is a very dark brown, almost black.  To the east, you
can see the city walls.

5005.long:
You're on a dry, sandy road.  It is notably hot here.  As the mists
spin and change to the north, you can see dying trees.  Looking south,
you see trees that have obviously been dead for a while.  There are no
leaves and the bark appears black.

5006.long:
The heat here is overwhelming.  Looking to the west you can see two
columns of fire flowing out of the ground and extending all the way up
into the sky above.  Northward your sight is obscured by swirling
white mists.  To the south the trees look as if they have been charred
by fire.

5007.long:
You are just east of the center of town, on one of the city's major
streets.  To the north, you see a large, condemned building.  The door
is nailed shut, and there are no visible windows.  To the south, you
see the back of what appears to be a holy building of some sort,
guessing from the symbols posted on the walls.

5008.long:
You are standing at the intersection of two streets.  To the east,
Ocean Street continues to the end of the town.  A small street
intersects this one from the north and continues to the south.

5009.short: ...You're at the end of a wet road.
5009.long:
You are just outside the city walls.  To the west, you see the might of
the large city walls.  The gate is open, allowing passage in and out of
the city.  To the north, you see a vined forest.  There are rich, full
trees to the south.

5010.long:
The road appears a bit damp here.  Trees to the north seem to have a
few clinging vines encircling the trunk, reaching for the branches.
Southward, the trees are growing tall and full.  There are also some
small bushes at the bases of the trees.  Far to the west, you can see
the city walls.

5011.long:
Water puddles cover most of the road beneath you.  There are trees to
the north that appear a little strange.  Vines are creeping up and
extending out onto and hanging over the branches.  Observing the trees
to the south, you notice how dark and lush the leaves appear.

5012.long:
It is so wet here that your skin actually feels moist.  The road is
covered with water.  To the north, the trees are hardly
distinguishable.  The growing vines have completely overcome the trees,
linking all the trees together with an odd criss-crossing pattern.  The
trees lying southward have grown over so much, they now are too thick
to navigate.  To the east, water flows in two huge columns all the way
up into the sky.

5013.long:
You are just north of the center of town, between two imposing
buildings.  The building to the east appears condemned, with boards
covering all visible windows.  To the west, you can see the side of a
building, but it is devoid of windows or doors.

5014.long:
You are at the intersection of Cloud Street and a minor street running
east and west.  To the north, Cloud Street continues towards the city
gates.  The road here appears to be rather worn, with most of the
cobblestones rounded and smoothed out.

5015.short: ...You're at the end of a dusty road.
5015.long:
You are standing just outside the north wall of the city.  To the
south, the city gate stands open, allowing your passage.  There are
trees to the west, although they appear to be slightly dehydrated.  To
the east, the trees are very narrow and sickly.

5016.long:
There is a constant light breeze blowing from the north.  There are
trees to the west that can barely been seen through wispy clouds.
The east has trees that are being covered by various vines.  To the
south, you can see the city walls.

5017.long:
The wind is blowing briskly here and the sky is mostly overcast with
clouds.  Shadows of trees can be seen to the west through the
mists.  The trees to the east have vines that have taken over most of
the trees.

5018.long:
It is difficult to stand with the wind gusting past you so hard.  You
cannot see past the thick mists to the west.  Eastward, the trees
are so overgrown with vines you have a hard time telling the trees from
the vines.  Staring off to the north, you can see two huge cyclones.

5019.long:
You are just south of the center of town.  On both sides of you are
buildings.  The building to the west is bare, with no visible windows
or doors.  To the east, you see a building with a number of holy
symbols inscribed on the wall, but you see no entrance from this side.

5020.long:
A street intersects Iron Street from the east, turning into an alley as
it continues west.  The pavement here is well-maintained, with all of
the cobblestones neatly set and aligned.

5021.short: ...You're at the end of a dusty road.
5021.long:
You are standing just beyond the confines of the city.  To the north,
the city walls block your view.  The city gate is wide open, allowing
passage under the huge walls.  Looking to the west you notice the trees
have darker than normal bark, and fewer leaves than usual.  To the east
there are also trees, but they look young and healthy.

5022.long:
The trees to the west have hardly any leaves and the bark is almost
black in color.  The east reveals full grown trees with large
overhanging branches.  To the north, you can see the southern walls of
the city.

5023.long:
The road here is very rocky, making passage slower.  Eastward lies a
lush forest with dark thick leaves growing on all the trees.  To the
west you see trees that are lacking life.  They appear leafless and
black.

5024.long:
The jagged road continues on to the south, almost impassible with the
large rocks jutting from below.  There are trees to the west that
appear completely destroyed by fire.  Your view east is obstructed by
thickly growing underbrush.  To the south are two large granite columns
that tower above you.

5025.long:
You are standing in the western half of the town, on one of the main
streets.  Hades Street appears not to be maintained very well, for
there are many potholes and cobblestones turned sideways.  However, the
majority of the street is flat, making passage easy.  To the north, you
see a building with smoke coming from its chimney.  South is the back
wall of Wenzel's shop, and you can see tools strewn about the floor
through a window.

5026.short: ...You're at the end of Hades Street.
5026.long:
This is the end of Hades Street, where the city gate stands.  Through
the gate, you can see a dusty road extend away from the city
towards a great volcano.  The huge bulk of the city wall blocks all
other visibility to the west.  A minor street runs north and south,
providing passage in those two directions.

5027.long:
The road here is fairly wet, with numerous puddles full of stagnant
water.  The building to the north appears to be abandoned, with all of
the windows broken, and a door completely boarded-up.  To the south,
you can see a window into the town bar, although there is no door on
this side of the building.

5028.short: ...You're at the end of Ocean Street.
5028.long:
You are at the end of Ocean Street, at the city gate.  To the east, the
city wall blocks almost all of your view.  Through the gate, you can
see a road continue to a marshy area.  A street extends north of here
and there is an alley to the south.

5029.long:
You're near the north end of the city.  To the west, the city wall
blocks your passage with its stone walls, rising high into the air.  To
the east, you can see the back wall of the old library.  Cloud Street
continues north towards the city walls.

5030.short: ...You're at the end of Cloud Street.
5030.long:
The road ends here at the city wall.  To the north, your view is
eclipsed by the rather large wall.  The city gate is open, and you can
see the road extend north to the horizon.  There is a littered alley to
the east.

5031.long:
You are in the southern half of the city, between a pair of run-down
buildings.   To the west, you see a fairly short building with a shaded
window on the side.  The building to the east is very worn, with
numerous small holes in the wall.  You also notice a slight scent
coming from the building, but you can't identify it.

5032.short: ...You're at the end of Iron Street.
5032.long:
The city wall begins here, ending the road at the city gate.  Although
you cannot see much to the south because of the wall, you can see a
mountainous area through the gate.  To the west, a small alley
parallels the city wall and there is an alley to the east.

5033.long:
You're in a dark alley, cast in shadows from the large city wall to the
north.  The road here is broken up, with patches of cobblestones amidst
the dirt.  You have to navigate around large piles of trash to move
anywhere.  To the south, there is the wall of a building, but there are
no visible entrances.  The alley continues to the east, and Cloud
Street lies to the west.
5033.item: lying in a pile of trash.

5034.long:
You're at the end of a very dark alley.  The city wall looms up to the
north and east, blocking out most of the sun's light.  In the
near-darkness, you can make out heaps of discarded trash.  The alley
continues to the south and west.

5035.long:
This road appears to be somewhat neglected, accumulating bits and
pieces of garbage.  To the east, the city wall bars your passage with
its solid, gray brickwork.  There is a door to the west labeled
"Library", but it appears to be rather old and the hinges need oil.  To
the south, a more prominent street intersects this alley.

5036.long:
You are standing at the corner of an alley.  To the west and north, the
city walls block your passage.  The alley continues to the east and
becomes a more well-tended road to the south.

5037.long:
This section of alley runs east to west.  To the north, the city wall
blocks your passage, although you notice someone has written something
on the wall.  To the south, the side of a building blocks your passage.
Through a window, you can see a room full of suits of armor.  You can
exit to the east or west.

5038.long:
You're at the intersection of two small streets.  To the north, the
city wall prevents movement.  South and east are two relatively unused
streets that lead to the main streets of the town.  There is a slightly
dirty alley to the west.

5039.long:
This small street borders the entrance to Izalig's Magic Shoppe, which
appears to be open to the south.  The street continues to the west and
meets Cloud Street to the east.  The city wall looms over you to the
north.

5040.long:
You are near the city gates, just north of the end of Hades Street.  To
the east, you can see the open door to Hanrod's armory, with a forge
burning near the back.  The street becomes an alley to the north and
the city wall stands to the west.  You notice some scribbled writing on
the wall, also.
5040.item: lying in the on the cobblestones.

5041.long:
You're on a small street between a pair of buildings.  To the west, you
see a building with no visible marks, although there is smoke coming
from its chimney.  To the east, you see the side of another building,
devoid of windows.  There street continues north and intersects Hades
Street to the south.

5042.long:
This street is just west of Cloud Street, intersecting it in that
direction.  There is an abandoned old building to the south, but all
entrances appear to be boarded up.  To the north is a run-down building
in slightly better condition, but still quite ragged.  The small street
continues east.
5042.item: lying in near the condemned building.

5043.long:
The street here branches here, intersected from the south by another
street.  To the north, an littered alley is visible, although it looks
as if it might be populated.  To the east, the street continues towards
the city wall.
5043.item: lying in the middle of the street.

5044.long:
You're on a street, near an abandonded building.  To the south, you see
a condemned building, with covered windows.  The door is boarded up,
but appears to be hanging off its hinges, allowing passage into its
dark confines.  The street continues east and west, and the city wall
blocks passage to the north.

5045.long:
The street here curves from west to south here, with the city wall
blocking passage to the north and east.  You notice a few loose stones
in the wall, but it still appears to be very solid.

5046.long:
You're on a less-traveled street, just north of Ocean Street.  To the
west, you see a condemned building, completely closed off and boarded
up.  To the east, you see a similar building.  The street continues
north towards the city wall and intersects Ocean Street to the south.

5047.long:
This a small street, just north of Ocean Street.  To the north, the
street continues and then appears to bend west.  The city wall looms to
the east and there is an old, condemned building to the west of here.
Ocean Street lies a short walk to the south.

5049.long:
You're in what is apparently Wenzel's work area, for this room is
populated by dozens of tools, lying almost everywhere.  There is an
anvil on one side of the room, with a bucket of rather dirty water next
to it.  Bits and chunks of metal are underfoot and collected in buckets
near the anvil.

5050.long:
The store is filled with many fine weapons.  The south wall is covered
with various types of polished, bladed weapons.  The north wall holds
all sorts of blunt weapons, including maces, pole arms, and whips.
There is a door open to the street to the south and a small arch to
another room in the north.
5050.item: on the red tile of the shop.

5051.long:
Looking about, you can see armor of all types.  Against the east wall
there are mismatched pieces of armor heaped in piles, ranging from
leather to plate mail.  Near the back of the shop, you see a forge with
burning coals and a rather worn anvil next to it.  The back wall
is lined with tools of all kinds.  There is an open door to the street
to the west.

5052.long:
This place is a mess.  There is broken glass all over the floor against
the east wall.  Piles of badly tarnished swords and armor are heaped
into the north-west corner.  There is a huge oak desk in front of you
which is apparently where the shopkeeper does his transactions.  You
can exit to the south.

5053.long:
This well-kept shop is the town jeweler, who deals exclusively in
precious gems and other trinkets.  There are glass cases along the
walls, showing the jeweler's shining wares.  Behind a desk covered with
tools and magnifying glasses, you see the proprietor of the shop,
busily filing something.  The door to the north opens up to a passing
alley.

5054.long:
The room is relatively small, but your mind is flooded with the images
of all the glass bottles lining the shelves that are filled with
different spell components.  Your eyes glance over everything from
bright blinding gems, to small ripened acorns.  You can exit to the
street to the north.
5054.item: sitting on the shiny silver floor.

5055.long:
You're in a very packed library, with books and scrolls lining every
wall.  Although there are piles of books everywhere, any topic you
researched here could very well be absent or impossible to find.  There
is a set of stairs going up, but they appear to be blocked by a partial
collapse of the old building.  You can exit to the alley to the east.

5056.long:
The bar is a warm, friendly place.  There are tables surrounding a warm
hearth, and a well-worn bar populated with patrons and a few empty
stools.  Behind the bar, Byrmic is busy pouring drinks and cleaning
glasses.  The wenches here are busy as well, constantly serving the
hungry patrons.  There is a stairway up to the loft with the sign
"OCCUPIED" hung on a nail next to it.  The street is visible through a
door to the west.

5057.long:
The walls here are made of highly polished wood.  The air smells
lightly of pine and roses.  Against the walls are small wooden benches
made of the same fine grain wood.  You see an altar in the corner of
the room, away from the door.  You can exit south to the street.

5058.long:
Looking around you notice that this shop once was a fine gem and
jewelry shop.  But now the fine tables and furnishings are broken and
strewn about the room as if looted many times.  You can exit to the
north.

5059.long:
This is the bar's loft, which apparently doubles as an inn.  There is a
small bed on one side of the room that is apparently occupied by a
customer.  There is a locked chest at the foot of the bed, which
appears to belong to the person sleeping in the bed.

5061.short: ...You're sprawled out on a shop floor.
5061.long:
Looking about from your haphazard landing on the cold stone floor, you
seem to be in some type of abandoned kitchen.  There is a dirty sink
full of broken dishes.  All the cupboards seem to be open and empty.
There seems to be another room to the west and a small drainage tunnel
to the east.

5062.long:
Going behind the huge tree you can see the side of an old building
that is mostly concealed by bushes and vinery.  At the base of the
building is a group of bushes with wild flowers blooming all over
them.

5063.long:
This dark tunnel has a slight odor of human waste.  The farther you go
into the tunnel, the more and more your legs cramp up.  The tunnel
finally stops at a large grate that blocks your path.  In the north
wall is a small hole.
5063.item: lying on the dirty, wet ground.

5064.short: ...You're standing in a once quarantined healing shop.
5064.long:
You feel wary as you look about the room.  Dirty linens and broken beds
litter the room.  There is broken glass covering the floor, assumably
from vials of old potions.  Among the shelves are growing strange
